He has long worked the land, growing and harvesting yucca, plantanos, pineapples and rice.  He also raises farm animals--chickens and guinea pigs, for example--for sale.  He is an enterprising, hard-working man who has pulled his family ahead thanks in part to the support of the Paititi community bank.  Ignacio will use this loan to buy farm animals that he will raise and sell.

loans.use: to buy animals for his animal-sales business.

loans.name: Khursand

texts.ru: Хурсанд простой фермер с богатым внутренним миром. Она родилась в 1974 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Хурсанд вместе со своими детьми занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур, как помидор, картофель, лук и т.п. Она выращивает овощи на 0.35 га земли, который находится возле ее дома. Хурсанд продает свой урожай на местном рынке. Хурсанд упорно работает с раннего утра до позднего вечера. Основная забота семьи лежит на плечах Хурсанда, так как ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Хурсанд должна провести свадебное торжество своего сына, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества своего сына. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Khursand is a simple farmer with a rich inner world.  She was born in 1974, is married, and is raising four children.  Khursand and her children grow crops such as tomatoes, potatoes, onions, and so forth.  They raise the vegetables on 0.35 HA of land next to their home.  Khursand sells their harvests at the local market.  Khursand works tirelessly from early morning to late in the evening.  Her family's main cares rest on Khursand's shoulders, because her husband is an emigrant laborer working in Russia.

Khursand's son is getting married and she must throw the wedding party, but she doesn't have the money.  She is requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni (TJS) for her son's wedding party.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to throw a wedding party of her son

loans.name: Julio Wilmer

texts.es:
Julio, está acompañado, vive con su compañera de su vida y tiene dos hijos de 11 y 8 años, todos dependen económicamente de él, de su padre aprendió la siembra de maíz y frijoles, es una actividad que desempeña desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 2:00 p.m., es un  negocio que le ha dado ningún problema.
Con la inversión comprara fertilizantes, plaguicidas, abono y semilla, para que el terreno donde sembrara esté debidamente preparado, espera aumentar la producción, tener mejores ganancias, y diversificar más la siembra.
Su prioridad es que sus hijos sean profesionales, para que tengan mayores oportunidades de desarrollo, tener un negocio más amplio y una economía mejorada.
texts.en:
Julio is in a relationship with his life companion. He has two children (ages 11 and 8) who are completely dependent on him. Julio learned how to plant corn and beans from his father. He works at his job from 6:00 A.M. to 2:00 P.M. His business has not given him any problems.

With this investment, Julio will buy fertilizers, fungicides, compost, and seeds so that he can properly prepare the land for planting. He hopes to increase production, generate more income, and diversify his crops.

His priority is to see his children become professionals so that they will have more opportunities for development. He also wants to have a larger business and improved finances.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, fungicides, compost, and seeds.

loans.name: Sento

texts.en:
Meet 33-year-old Sento from Jui, Sierra Leone. She is married with three children.  For the past 13 years, Sento has had a local food market. She began her business because she wanted to empower herself.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She is very hard-working and desires to improve her standard of living.

Sento requires a loan in order to purchase rice, sugar and milk to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to start a savings account and increase her business. In the future, Sento plans to further expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar and milk to expand her business.

loans.name: Hawanatu

texts.en:
Meet Hawanatu. She is a 30-year-old from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children. For the past 10 years, Hawanatu has established her cookery business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Hawanatu requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil, rice and cooking seasonings to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Hawanatu plans to open a big clothing shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Marian

texts.es:
Marian es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, está en su tercer año, y comenta que estudio esta carrera para salir adelante y poder crecer.
Comenta que le gusta poder ayudar  a las personas, y que su mayor sueño es poder hacer un postgrado en hemodiálisis.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas, ya que podrá cubrir ese gasto. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo de poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Marian is from the city of Coronel Oviedo and is a nursing student.  She is in her third year and says that she chose this career so that she could grow and get ahead.

She also says that she wants to help people and her greatest dream is to do postgraduate work in hemodialysis.

She is asking for this loan so that she can pay tuition and is grateful for the opportunity to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: San Lorenzo Group

texts.es:
El comité San Lorenzo está conformado por mujeres luchadoras que trabajan día a día para poder tener sus propios ingresos., y por medio de eso poder ayudar a sus familias. Son mujeres muy sacrificadas y emprendedoras.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Epifania, que se dedica exclusivamente a la cría de animales, ella comenta que con sus  50 años de edad y con la lucha constante del día a día también se dedica a los cultivos de frutas y verduras  consciente de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser  constante para lograr el progreso que anhela alcanzar.
La Sra. Epifania solicita de este crédito para la compra de  balanceados para sus animales, y de esa forma poder invertir en su actividad, lo que le ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio, y a mejorar sus ingresos. En la foto del grupo aparecen 16 personas, ya que esa es la cantidad de integrantes de este grupo, pero esta vez solo 14 retiran de este crédito.
texts.en:
The San Lorenzo Committee is made up of hardworking women who work daily to be able to have their own businesses and help their families.  They are entrepreneurial woman who make many sacrifices.

Epifania is one of the members and raises animals.  She says that at age 50, and with her daily work she also raises fruits and vegetables, knowing that this work and effort must be constant so that she can make the progress that she is striving for.

Epifania is asking for this loan to buy balanced feed for her animals.  This will help her to solidify her business plans and improve her income.  There are 16 persons in the photograph, but only 14 of them will receive part of this loan.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Señor De Huanca Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE HUANCA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
El socio es José Antonio, el tiene 50 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 05 hijos, el socio altera sus actividades diarias trabajando en una  empresa privada, el socio trabaja seis días a la semana y un día libre, él socio lleva trabajando buen tiempo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso siendo de esta manera que el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para continuar apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de víveres para su hogar como azucar, leche, arroz entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de helados, venta de ropa, sastrería, restaurante.
El socio que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Señor de Huanca” communal bank, this bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco. 

The member in question is José Antonio, he is 50 years old, has a live-in partner and has 5 children. José Antonio alternates his daily activities working in a private company. He works six days a week and has a day off. He has been working for a long time and it is going well thanks to the effort that he puts into his work every day. José Antonio is a responsible and persevering person and it is in this manner that he hopes to continue working in order to carry on supporting his family. José Antonio is seeking the loan to buy supplies for his household such as sugar, milk, rice and so on. 

The other members make their living selling ice-cream, clothes, in tailoring, and restaurants. The member appearing in the smaller photo sought permission to attend the meeting later because of work. José Antonio is grateful to those who are forming part of this dream via this scheme, and he pledges to meet the repayment within the set time frame.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her home such as sugar, milk, rice and so on.

loans.name: Lesly Yasmina

texts.es:
La señora  Lesly  Yasmina  de 35   años de edad, vive con su esposo,   tiene  02 hijos que dependen de ella, vive en casa de familiar,  en una  comunidad  de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña Lesly se dedica desde hace 04  años  al negocio de la venta de helados de todos sabores y presentaciones, compra al por mayor y salen todo los días a vender el producto.
Doña Lesly está solicitando el préstamo para compra de helados, cemento, ladrillos, estos últimos por que quiere realizarle unas mejoras a su casa pagar mano de obra para avanzar la construcción de su casa,  pero espera que  con el apoyo de Prisma a su inversión la terminara de construir.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2013.
texts.en:
Sra. Lesly Yasmina, 35, lives with her husband and two young children.  They live in a house they own in San Lorenzo, a town in southern Honduras. 
Doña Lesly has operated an ice-cream-sales business for 4 years.  She buys wholesale supplies of ice cream, of all kinds and flavors, and goes out every day to sell it.
Doña Lesly is applying for a loan, part of which she will use to buy ice cream and the rest to pay for the labor and supplies she needs to make improvements to her house.  She expects the loan will allow her to complete the work.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2013.

loans.use: to both stock her business and pay for improvements to her house.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru:
Баходуру 37 лет. Он женатый мужчина. Его жена работает медсестрой. Они воспитывают четверых детей. У них трое сына и одна дочка. Их дети учатся в школе. Баходур особое внимание обращает воспитанию, здоровью и образованию детей.
   Баходур является дехканином. Около 3 лет занимается растениеводством. Опыт работы и навыки в этой сфере он получил от отца. Многие жители района Яван и других районов, сел и деревень заняты сельским хозяйством. Баходур наравне с соседями и односельчанами спешно занимается посевом урожая, чтобы весной получить урожай. Для посева урожая Баходуру необходимы средства, на которые он купит минеральные удобрения, горючей смеси и семян. Для приобретения этих продуктов он просит кредит.
texts.en:
Bahodur is 37 years old and married.  His wife is a nurse, and they are raising four children.  They have three sons and a daughter, all of whom are in school.  Bahodur is very attentive to his children's upbringing, health, and education.  

Bahodur is a farmer.  For about three years he has been in this type of business.  He got all his know-how and experience working for his father.  Many residents of the Yavan and other regions, towns, and villages work in farming.  Bahodur, like his neighbors and the others in his village, is hurring to sow his crops so that he'll have a spring harvest.  For sowing, Bahodur needs the funds with which to buy mineral fertilizers, fuel, and seed.  He is requesting a loan to buy these things.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, fuel, and seed

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 26-year-old single young man from a small village near Tulkarem called Attel. He lives with his family in an old house in the village. Mohammad owns a mini-market in the village. It has been open for two years. It is a good business and earns a good income. Mohammad would like to improve his business but he does not have enough liquidity.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more basic products for his mini-market to resell. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to develop his business and buy all the needed stock. Mohammad appears in the photo while he was working

loans.use: to develop his business and buy all the needed stock to resell in his mini-market

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 18 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Margret has been working hard to manage her fish business, which sells small silver fish.

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more small silver fish and big smoked fish to sell, and will help Margret to generate greater profits and take care of her children. Margret hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a cow.

Margret is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.





"

loans.use: to buy more small silver fish and big smoked fish to sell,

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is 20 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past four years, Lillian has been working hard to manage her produce business, which sells maize flour, beans and rice. 

To help expand her business, Lillian has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more produce, and will help Lillian to generate greater profits and take care of her parents. Lillian hopes that in the future, she will be able to construct rental houses. 

Lillian is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more produce.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro tiene 45 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en la zona rural de Cayalti, su población se dedica al cultivo de caña, arroz, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la actividad de siembra y venta de alfalfa y chala, que lo distribuye a los caseríos aledaños a su comunidad, ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para comprar una mototaxi nueva, la que tenía tiene 10 años de antigüedad y es muy costoso repararla, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando y generando ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 45 years old and lives with his wife in the rural district of Cayalti. His town is known for the cultivation of sugar cane and rice, trade, and livestock breeding. This community is two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, which is on the northern coast of Peru.

Alejandro grows and sells alfalfa and corn husks, which he delivers to the neighboring villages in his community. He is requesting a loan of 4,000 PEN so that he can buy a new motorcycle taxi. The one he has is 10 years old and in need of costly repairs. This will enable him to continue working and generating income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle taxi for delivering his crops.

loans.name: Kendra Nerisa

texts.es:
Kendra es una joven emprendedora de 23 años de edad, soltera y sin hijos, actualmente pasante universitaria de la carrera Administración de Empresas. Ella vive con sus padres los cuales la apoyan y la motivan en todo lo posible siendo ellos quienes le enseñaran la actividad, estrategias, contactos y demás que hacen de un negocio exitoso ya que ellos también son comerciantes. Kendra tiene una tienda de venta de variedades de moda desde zapato cerrado, sandalia, botas hasta la rodilla, pendientes, pulseras, relojes, etc. dirigido al sexo femenino de todas las edades dedicándose a esta actividad por más de 5 años. Sus metas a corto plazo son comprar mercadería para la temporada navideña la cual es muy provechosa. Su sueño es formar una cadena de tiendas en diferentes partes del país y hacer de su tienda un éxito con el cual pueda asegurar los ingresos para sus estudios y en un futuro para sus hijos y su familia.
Por lo que hoy en día ella solicita financiamiento para la compra de mercadería como ser: 20 pares de zapatos de tacón alto, 35 pares de sandalia, 15 unidades de cartera para dama, 10 (unidades) monederos de mano, 50 unidades accesorios de toda variedad, 10 lociones y 6 pares de botas altas para mujer. Por lo que ella espera se le apoye y pueda cumplir las metas propuestas para esta temporada y principalmente sus sueños.
texts.en:
Kendra, 23, is a young entrepreneur.  She's single and has no children, and is currently an intern in business administration.  She lives with her parents, who support her and motivate her all they can: they're also merchants and they taught her the job, strategies, contacts, and everything that makes a successful business.

Kendra has a store where she sells a variety of clothing for women of all ages: shoes, sandals, ankle boots, necklaces, bracelets, watches, and so forth.  She has had this business for more than five years.

Her short-term goal is to buy merchandise for the Christmas season, which is very profitable.  Her dream is to create a chain of stores throughout the country and make her store a success.  This way she'll be able to secure the income to pay for her studies and, in the future, her children and her family.

For this reason Kendra's requesting financing to buy merchandise: 20 pairs of high-heeled shoes, 35 pairs of sandals, 15 women's wallets, 10 change purses, 50 accessories of various types, 10 containers of lotion, and 6 pairs of high boots for women.  She hopes for support so she can realize her seasonal goals and her dreams.

loans.use: to buy women's shoes

loans.name: Ramon Antonio

texts.es: Ramón, un señor de 56 años de edad, es originario de la ciudad de Estelí. Es casado y padre de 8 hijos. Su oficio es de comerciante, se dedica a la venta de repuestos de bicicletas.  Hace 14 años, inicio un pequeño negocio con poco dinero, Reparando y vendiendo repuestos de bicicletas, poco a poco fue creciendo su negocio hasta lo que tiene hoy con un inventario que lo hace orgulloso del único negocio que ha tenido en su vida. Su meta próxima es incrementar sus ventas a través del surtido de su taller así ofreciendo a sus clientes un gama de productos más variado. Solicita el crédito para comprar repuestos de bicicletas como: rines, rayos, llantas, manecillas, entre otros con el fin de cumplir con la demanda de sus clientelas.  Estima que el crédito le ayudará hacer su negocio más surtido así que sus clientes sean leales porque sabrán que el servicio es bueno. Su plan futuro es mejorar su vivienda y establecer otra sucursal en otro municipio.
texts.en: Ramon, 56, is from the city of Esteli.  He is married and the father of 8 children.  He started a bicycle parts business 14 years ago, using a little money he had for a shop where he repaired bicycles and sold bicycle parts.  The business, the only one that he has ever owned, has slowly grown over the years and now has an inventory that anyone would be proud of.  Ramon wants to grow the business further and broaden the range of products that he sells.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to buy the parts--rims, spokes, tires, etc.--that his customers most want.  He believes the loan will help him to fully stock his business and, in turn, ensure that his customers keep coming to him for what they need.  For the future, he wants to improve his house and open a branch of his business in another town.

loans.use: to stock his bicycle parts business.

loans.name: Elsuida

texts.en: Elsuida is a young married mother of a six-month-old child who lives in northern Albania and has run her own livestock business for the past three years.  “As soon as we married, we both decided to go into the livestock. We had and knew nothing else to do, but just do what majority of people in the village do. This though, has been the source of income for our little family. We started it small and we will see as we go, yet for sure we will try to expand it in the future. For now all I want is to expand the existing stable, because animals have no enough room to stretch their legs while asleep,” said Elsuida.

loans.use: to expand the existing stable.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Maria wants to buy a dairy cow. Maria, who lives in the northern part of the country, is a 52-year-old married mother of six children; one of them has been suffering from a disease since birth. 

“I have to look after my daughter almost all the time; two other kids passed away also due to the same disease. The livestock activity, I have been carrying it out since 1993. That has been the only source of income for all of us. At times, I feel drained from doing so much, but thank God my other kids and husband help me out,” said Maria.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Felix Armando

texts.es: Don Felix, es un señor de 45 años de edad, que se dedica a la compra y venta de artículos para el hogar, el es soltero, tiene a su cargo a un  hijo menor de 7 años de edad quien asiste a la escuela primaria y depende únicamente de su padre. Don Felix solicita el crédito para poder abastecerse de muebles como gabeteros, comedor de madera, estantes, sillas entre otros, con esta inversión el señor Felix desea aumentar las ventas para formar su propio ahorro para estar preparado por cualquier emergencia o dificultad que se le pueda presentar en el futuro y así continuar manteniendo los diferentes gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Don Felix, 45, operates a furniture sales business.  He is the single father of a 7-year old son who goes to the local primary school and for whom he is solely responsible.  Don Felix is applying for a loan that he will use to build an inventory of furniture--cabinets, dining sets, shelving, chairs, etc.--that he will ultimately resell.  Don Felix says that this investment in his business will allow him to both cover everyday household expenses and save for any emergency that might arise in the future.

loans.use: to stock his furniture sales business.

loans.name: Martín De Jesús

texts.es:
Martín de 50 años de edad,  debido a las condiciones económicas de su familia apenas pudo cursar un 6º grado, su esposa es maestra y sus hijos ya no están con él, ya son adultos y casados, vive una nieta con él  y su esposa.

 Luego dejar  de estudiar y se dedico a trabajar con su padre en la agricultura. Al pasar los años trabajo en caminos como colaborador arreglando las calles, trabajo mas de 15 años en estos lugares, luego trabajo 2 años como ayudante de albañil con un pariente; quien le enseño lo básico para esta actividad. Después,  tomo la decición de trabajar por su cuenta tomando trabajos pequeños a medida pasaban los años fue adquiriendo mas experiencia y mas clientes, esto fue hace 30 años, en este transcurso de tiempo pudo con mucho esfuerzo comprar un pequeño terreno, trabajando de día construyendo una casa por encargo y por las noches construyendo su casa  y con mucho esfuerzo termino su vivienda. Los trabajos para que lo buscan en lugares cercanos de su casa y trabaja todo el día hasta por la tarde, 


Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados, para la compra de herramientas para uso exclusivo de la construcción. Él manifestó que espera para un futuro terminar su casa, ya que le hacen falta terminarle de construir la casa de su madre, ya que debido al tiempo no se la podido terminar.
texts.en:
Martin is 50 years old and, due to his family's financial situation, he only finished up to sixth grade at school.  Martin's wife is a teacher.  Their children no longer live at home - they are grown-up and married.  One of their grandchildren lives with Martin and his wife.

After leaving school, Martin started working in farming with his father.  Later on, he spent 15 years working as a road worker, helping to fix the roads.  Later still Martin spent two years as a builder, working with a relative who taught Martin the basics of this work.  With this experience, Martin decided to start taking on small jobs independently.  As the years passed, he gained more experience and more customers.  This was now 30 years ago and, as time has gone by, with a lot of effort Martin has been able to buy a small plot of land.  During the days he worked on other people's houses and at night he built his own.  With a lot of hard work, Martin will finish building his house.  People now come looking for Martin to do work in nearby places.  He works all day long.

This loan will be used to buy tools for building work.  Martin tells us that he hopes to finish his house in the future as he still has to finish building his mother's house.  Due to time constraints he has not been able to do this yet.

loans.use: to buy tools for building work.

loans.name: Xiomara Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Xiomara es originaria de la ciudad de Granada, tiene 44 años de edad. Casada y madre de tres hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de verduras. Inicio este negocio vendiendo plátanos, luego con las ganancias obtenidas fue comprando diversidad de verduras. Hoy en día cuenta con un negocio grande donde oferta todo tipo de verduras. Su meta próxima es seguir aumentando su negocio y poder ofrecerles a sus clientes un surtido de productos. Solicita el crédito para comprar: papas, plátanos, ayote, pipián entre otros, con el fin de incrementar la clientela. Estima que el crédito le será de ayuda ya que aumentara las ventas y obtendrá mejores ganancias. Su plan futuro es mejorar su negocio e incrementando el nivel de verduras.
texts.en:
Xiomara is from the city of Granada and is 44 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. A vendor by trade, she sells vegetables. She started this business selling plantains, and later, with the profits she obtained, began to buy a variety of vegetables. Now she has a large business where she offers every kind of vegetable. 

Her immediate goal is to continue increasing her business to be able to offer her clients a variety of products. She is requesting the loan to buy potatoes, plantains, squash and other items, with the aim of increasing her clientele. She considers that the loan will be a help to her, as she will increase her sales and obtain better earnings. Her future plan is to improve her business by increasing her supply of vegetables.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, plantains, squash and other items.

loans.name: Dava

texts.en:
Dava wants to buy four dairy sheep. This will be her third loan, with the previous ones being paid off. 
Dava is married and has three children; she is forty-seven-years-old.  About seven years ago, she started to expand her herd.  With the animals she had at that moment, she only supplied her family with its dairy needs, yet, she wanted to earn an income of it. She has studied at the public university; however, finding a job in her profession was like "finding the hay in the needle stack," according to her. Thus, it made sense to her to pursue livestock.
“I don’t regret my decision, because I was fully aware that there would be no opportunities available in my profession…I make my income through this activity, and this is what matters in the end,” said Dava.

loans.use: to buy four dairy sheep.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a 28-year-old single man who divorced his wife due to family problems. He has four children. He deals in goat rearing and trade as his source of income, which he has been doing for five years. He applied for a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings to help him buy more goats for trade. 

He hopes to construct a good house for his children and also take them to good schools.

loans.use: To buy more goats for selling.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is a 45-year-old villager from the northern part of Albania who wants to build a stable with this loan; the existing stable, as you can see in the photograph, is in bad shape. 

“The winter is starting soon and I am very worried about my animals. I don’t want them to sleep in the cold; our region is very cold as we are close to the Alps,” said Marie. 

Marie is married and has three children, with two of them still attending school. Her husband suffered a car accident not long ago, and she has been looking after him as well. “My husband is not capable of helping in any way now, and I’ve got to do everything by myself and this makes it tougher,” continued Marie.

Livestock has been the activity that she has pursued these past 13 years.

loans.use: to build a stable.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina nació en la ciudad de Accha pero actualmente vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata. (La ciudad de Pilcopata está ubicada en el distrito del Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo en el departamento de Cusco, Perú). Paulina tiene 41 años y es separada de su pareja pero tiene seis hijos. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de ropa como por ejemplo polos, faldas, ropa interior, camisas, blusas y otras más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia pues ella pertenece al banco comunal “Paititi”. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como ropa. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Paulina was born in the town of Accha, but now lives in the town of Pilcopata, located in Kosñipata district, in Paucartambo province, in Cusco department, Peru. Polina is 41, separated from partner, but has six children. 

Her main business is selling clothing such as T-shirts, skirts, underwear, shirts, blouses and other items. She has been working in this business for several years now and it is going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She is a very enterprising and hard-working woman who is helping her family get ahead in life, as she belongs to the "Paititi" communal bank. On this occasion she needs the loan to buy more merchandise such as clothing. She is grateful for and appreciates the loan and promises to make the monthly installment payments.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise such as clothing.

loans.name: Bonerge

texts.es: Bonerge es originario de la comunidad de san remigio  tiene de residir 8 años aproximadamente  vive con su esposa y un hijo  que tiene 19 años de edad .El  comenta que desde muy temprana edad el comenzó a trabajar para poder subsistir y apoyar a su familia , desde entonces se ha  dedicado  a trabajar en una empresa camaronera  que esta ubicada  cerca de zona , ademas de dedicarse a actividades de la agricultura con el apoyo de su hijo . El desea tener luz eléctrica en su vivienda pero que llegue la energía convencional pronto  esta un poco difícil , es por eso que desea hacer tramite de este credito para adquirir un sistema solar que le permita llevar luz a su hogar.
texts.en: Bonerge has lived in the rural town of San Remigio for about 8 years.  He lives with his wife and 19-year old son.  He says that he had to start working at a very young age just to survive and has always had to work hard.  He now makes a living partly from work at a local trucking company and partly from farming with his son.  He wants electricity but there's not much chance of getting it from conventional sources and he's applying for this loan so that he can buy a solar-powered system that will generate enough electricity to power his house.

loans.use: to buy solar-powered system for powering his house.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen nació en la ciudad de Acomayo pero vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata. (La ciudad de Pilcopata está ubicada en el distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo en el departamento de Cusco, Perú), él tiene 71 años de edad, es separado pero tiene dos hijos, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia y su actividad económica principal es la venta de mercadería como frazadas, sandalias, zapatillas y algunos productos de ferretería. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, él pertenece al banco comunal “Paititi” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar zapatillas. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en: Carmen was born in the city of Acomayo but now lives in the city of Pilcopata.  (Pilcopata is a city in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.)  He is 71-years old, separated and the father of two children.  Carmen is a hard-working, enterprising man and has built his own business.  He sells blankets, sandals, sneakers and miscellaneous hardware.  He has operated the business for several years and it is a success thanks to his persistence and hard work.  Carmen is a member of the Paititi community bank and he is applying for a loan that he will use to buy sneakers for resale.  He is grateful to lenders and says that he is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to stock his sales business.

loans.name: Mario Roberto

texts.es:
Mario de 56 años de edad, debido a las condiciones económicas de su familia, no le pudieron dar el estudio ya que solo vivía con su madre y sus dos hermanos, tenia que trabajar todo el día, su esposa se dedica al trabajo domésticos, todos sus hijos ya están separados de su casa y formado su propio hogar.

Mario se dedica a trabajar la agricultura, la que le enseño fue su madre ya que con ella cultivaban la milpa, lo realizo desde muy pequeño trabajando todos los días, también se dedica al cuido de ganado de repasto. Todos los días tiene que madrugar para sacarles la leche a sus vacas, luego se dirige a dejarlas donde comen y después se dirige al cultivo a un kilómetro de su casa; por la tarde va a traer sus animales, los que le ayudan son sus hijos quienes se dividen el trabajo agrícola, pero siempre le ayudan a completar el trabajo propio.


los fondos del crédito serán utilizados para la compra de dos bovinos. Para el futuro desea, comprar mas animales (bovinos) lecheros ya que tiene 2.
texts.en:
Mario who is 56 years old was unable to study due to his family's financial situation as given the fact that he only lived with his mother and his two sisters, he had to work the whole day through. His wife makes her living in housekeeping, and all of his children have already left home and live in their own place.

Mario makes his living in agriculture, which his mother taught him as he used to grow corn with her. From a very young age he has been doing this activity, working every day. He also tends to cattle. Every day he has to get up early to milk his cows, then guide them to pastures and them he heads to the crop which is one kilometer away from his home. In the after, he steers back his cows, it is his children who help him and they divide the farming tasks, but they always help him to finish the work. 

The money from the loan will be used to buy cows. In the future, Mario hopes to buy more animals (dairy cows) as he has two.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials for his painting workshop and to do some improvements to his house.

loans.name: Outifafa Group

texts.en:
The group called "Outifafa" comprises eight women entrepreneurs who are seeking better opportunities to move on in life. They live in the city of Accra, a beautiful place where trading is very popular and well established.

They are into the sales of foodstuff, secondhand clothing, frozen fish and meat, palm oil, fresh fish, maize, wigs, jewelry and cosmetics.

This is their first loan with Kiva and the ninth loan cycle with ID-Ghana.

One of the members, Grace, has been in the group for the past five years and has established a good friendship with all her neighbors and friends. She likes the fact that all the members of the group are united and much like a family.

Grace, 43, is single and has three dependent children who are staying with her. She rents the house she lives in and her children are school going.

For 20 years, Grace, who is standing third from the left in the photo, has been selling foodstuff throughout the week by walking to her customers.

She plans to use the new loan to buy plantains, cassava, vegetables and coco-yams so that she can sell enough to take care of her children. Her goal is to stay healthy so she can keep working to take care of her children. The needed total loan amount of GHS 10,600 is to buy more stock to sell.

loans.use: To buy plantains, cassava, vegetables and coco-yams so that she can sell enough to take care of her children.

loans.name: María Marlenny

texts.es: María es cabeza de hogar, pues lleva toda la carga económica desde que su esposo falleció, razón por la cual decidió iniciar su propio negocio, una pequeña tienda de abarrotes ubicada en la sala de la casa donde reside con sus dos hijos. Allí trabaja sola todos los días desde muy temprano en la mañana, ofrece diversos productos como lácteos, galletería, chocolate, café, productos de aseo, entre otros y, de esta manera genera los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos del hogar. A pesar de las adversidades, ella siempre mantiene una actitud positiva y se esfuerza cada día, motivada por la necesidad de salir adelante y por sus hijos, que son su motor para seguir avanzando. Actualmente solicita el crédito ya que lo desea invertir en la compra de surtido al por mayor (mecato, dulces, lácteos, cárnicos, huevos, granos, pastas, entre otros), así tendrá más variedad en su inventario y podrá satisfacer las necesidades de sus compradores, logrando una fidelización y mejorando los ingresos que recibe para su familia. María tiene como meta seguir trabajando arduamente para fortalecer más su negocio y ampliarlo, así mejorará la rentabilidad y podrá dar mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: Maria is her family's sole breadwinner.  She started the business--a small grocery--after her husband died and operates it from a space in the house where she lives with her two children.  She works alone every day from early in the morning until late at night.  She sells everyday products--dairy, snacks, chocolate, coffee, toiletries and so on--and earns enough to cover family expenses.  Despite the obstacles she's faced, she's kept a positive attitude and soldiers on every day, driven by the need to support herself and, above all, her children.  Maria is applying for a loan that she will use to buy wholesale supplies of the products--pastries, sweets, dairy, meats, eggs, grains, pastas, etc.--that she needs to stock her business.  The investment will allow her to meet the needs of her customers and, in turn, ensure they keep coming back.  For the future, Maria wants to grow and strengthen her business, making it ever more profitable so that she can provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her general store.

loans.name: Delmy Yoselin

texts.es: Delmy tiene 21 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de León. Es una joven soltera y estudiante de la carrera de contabilidad pública y finanza, en la cual se encuentra en su último año. Con muchos esfuerzos y dedicación ha salido adelante. Su familia la apoya en sus estudios para que sea una persona con éxito en la vida. Es una joven con grandes metas y expectativas. Una de ellas es, ser una profesional completa. Solicita financiamiento para pagar el curso de  titulación, con el fin de completar sus sueños de ser una estudiante graduada.  Su plan futuro es trabajar en una gran empresa donde aplique todos sus conocimientos que ha adquirido.
texts.en:
Delmy is 21 years old and from the city of León. She is a single young woman studying for a degree in public accounting and finance, and is in her final year. With a great deal of effort and dedication she has been successful.  Her family helps her with her studies so that she can be a person with success in life. She is a young woman with great goals and hopes. One of these is to be a full professional. 

She is requesting a loan to pay for her graduation course, with the aim of fulfilling her dreams of being a graduate. Her future plan is to work at a big company where she can apply all the knowledge she has acquired.

loans.use: To pay for her graduation course.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred is a married man who lives in a rural area. He deals in coffee growing and trade. He requested a loan of 800,000 UGX to help him buy coffee from other farmers during the season. He hopes to get more profits from the sale of coffee to other traders. His major challenge is price fluctuations because he sells unprocessed coffee. If he gets money, he hopes to buy a motorcycle to help him transport his coffee to the machine since it is far in the town. Alfred is very honest and hard-working.

loans.use: to buy coffee

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a married man with four children and comes from a far-off trading center. Godfrey is a trustworthy and hardworking man. He deals in coffee farming and trade. He applied for a loan of UGX 600,000 to help him buy manure and fertilizers for his coffee plantation.

After applying these fertilizers, he hopes to increase his coffee harvests to 30 bags of coffee, take his children to good schools, and build a permanent home for his family.

loans.use: To buy organic manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Alcides Ricardo

texts.es: Alcides Ricardo, mayor de edad casado con tres hijos, los cuales dos aun están bajo su responsabilidad, originario del municipio de Chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, zona donde predomina el comercio, el turismo, sus hermosas playas y volcanes, se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable, de dedica a la compra venta de variedades tipos y estilo de muebles como: camas, roperos, juegos de sillas, cómodas, chineros, al igual que ofrece productos como: colchones, almohadas, entre otros. inicia su negocio con fondos propios ahorrados, donde poco a poco ha ido dándose a conocer por la calidad de muebles que el ofrece a todos sus clientes ya sean  fijos o eventual, sus ventas son al contado, y al crédito a clientes fijos, el realiza sus compras a carpinteros de occidente que le entregan al por mayor semanalmente y también adquiere de otros proveedores que se movilizan de otro municipio, el objetivo de este crédito es para poder suplir las demandas que tiene de parte de sus clientes y ofrecer nuevos productos en la compra de: roperos, camas individuales o matrimoniales, juegos de sillas entre otros.
texts.en: Alcides Ricardo is married and the father of three children, two of whom still live at home.  He lives in Chinandega, a rural town in western Nicaragua, an area of small businesses and a tourist industry built around its beautiful beaches and volcanoes.  Alcides Ricardo is a hard-working, responsible man who has built a furniture sales business.  He sells various styles and types of furniture--beds, wardrobes, chair sets, storage cabinets--along with mattresses, bedding, etc.  He started the business with his own savings and built it thanks in no small part to the quality of the furniture he sells.  Cash sales are normal but he extends credit to regular buyers.  He buys supplies of furniture from local carpenters twice a year and gets other furniture when he needs it from sellers in another town.  Alcides Ricardo will use this loan to stock his business and meet the demand of his customers for wardrobes, single and double beds, chair sets, etc.

loans.use: to stock his furniture business.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es: Fortunata agradece a los inversionistas que leyeron su historia y que les haya gusto mucho pues se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado y desea continuar participando en el proyecto, ella continua con la venta de verduras, comestibles y carnes. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella sigue siendo una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia pues ella pertenece al banco comunal “Paititi”, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras, carnes y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Fortunata thanks the investors who read her story.  She is happy for the help provided and wants to continue participating in this project. She continues with the sale of vegetables, groceries, and meat.  She has already invested several years in this business and is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. 

Fortunata continues to be an enterprising and hard-working woman that provides for her family; for this reason she belongs to the "Paititi" community bank. For this opportunity, she needs the loan to purchase vegetables and meat. She promises to complete the payment of her monthly quotas.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and meats.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose tiene 37 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene una pequeña parcela en la cual ha sembrado yuca; Jose le dedica alrededor de 9 horas al día, ya que siempre está al pendiente, ya que es trabajo como agricultor es su única fuente de ingresos para poder sacer adelante a su familia.

Jose está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda podrá, comprar abono, fertilizantes, dar mantenimiento, entre otros, de esta manera podrá tener una buena cosecha y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un fundo agrícola”.
texts.en:
Jose, 37, lives in the city of Pucallpa.  He has a small plot of land where he grows yucca.  He works about 9 hours a day, always on the lookout for potential problems because the crop is his only means of supporting his family

Jose says that he is grateful to Kiva lenders because their loans will allow him to pay for the supplies that he needs to harvest a good crop and, in turn, earn the money that he needs to fulfill his dream of "having a farm of my own".

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Lidia Theresa

texts.es:
Doña Lidia es una Mujer de 35 años de edad muy alegre, y soñadora que desde muy joven adquirió los conocimientos en la agricultura por medio de sus padres especializándose en el cultivo de café. Diariamente se levanta por la mañana a sus quehaceres para luego desplazarse hasta su centro de trabajo donde da clases como maestra de educación. Ella es madre de 1 hijo el cual esta pequeño y estudia en la escuela de la comunidad. Como esposa al salir de sus centro de trabajo se desplaza al campo para ayudar a su esposo el cual está a cargo de las diferentes actividades mientras ella no lo apoya como la limpieza, recolección del gano, aplicación de abono, etc. Doña Lidia Agradece a Dios diariamente por las muchas bendiciones que él le da siendo una de ellas su hijo y luego la tierra que en compañía de su esposo trabaja la cual es amplia y propia ubicada muy cerca de su casa permitiendo asistirla y estar al pendiente de su cuidado mientras no está en la escuela enseñando a niños. 
Sus sueños son los de poder seguir ampliando sus cultivos de café para que en el futuro su hijo pueda heredar una tierra digna y prospera la cual le permita tener una tierra donde vivir, donde trabajar y generar ingresos para su hogar. Por esa razón ella hoy en día solicita financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL con el cual comprara 20 unidades de nutricafe, 10 unidades de abono 18-46-0 y 4 botes de abono foliar con los cuales dará asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café para obtener una buena cosecha al final de la temporada.
texts.en:
Lidia is a 35 year old very happy woman and idealist. She acquired knowledge of agriculture when she was very young from her parents who specialized in growing coffee. Every day she gets up to do the morning chores and later she goes to the workplace where she gives classes as an educational teacher.

She is the mother of 1 son who is young and studies at the community school. As a wife, after she leaves her workplace, she goes to the field to help her husband who is in charge of the various activities such as cleaning, collection of the earnings, application of fertilizer, etc.

Lidia offers thanks to God everyday for the many blessings that he has given of which one is her son, and also the land that she works in the company of her husband which is large and located close to her home permitting her to be of help and accessible when she is not teaching the children at school.

Her dreams are to be able to continue expanding their coffee crops so that in the future her son can inherit land that is worthy and prosperous and which permits him to have land to live on, to work and generate income for the home.

This is why she is asking today for a loan from the COMIXMUL cooperative so she can buy 20 units of nutricafe, 10 units of 18-46-0 fertilizer, and 4 containers of foliar fertilizer which will give assistance and maintenance to their coffee crops in order to obtain a good harvest at the end of the season.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help maintain her coffee plants

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is a single man who divorced his wife due to family wrangles. He has three children who stay with him and are all in school. Gerald is honest and hardworking. 

He deals in coffee growing in Katonzi cell and usually harvests five bags of coffee from his plantation every season. His major challenges are thieves who steal his coffee still in the field and heavy sunshine which affects his coffee production.

He applied for a loan of 800,000 UGX to help him buy fertilizer and manure to add to his plantation. By doing this, he hopes to get better yields which will hence increase his cash flow. He also hopes to build a permanent home for his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Alexis Evanor

texts.es:
El señor Alexis  de 45 años de edad es soltero, vive con su  madre en su casa de habitación ubicada en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, Valle, se dedica a la venta de granos básicos, frescos y costura, desde hace unos 20 años.
Don Alexis es ingeniero pese a la falta de empleo en el País, tiene un pequeño negocio de abarrotería, también el costura a sus amigos sus ropas, el desea salir adelante con los ingresos que se gana en su oficio y su negocio, su deseo es montar un buen taller de costura. 
Don Alexis está solicitando el préstamo para surtir su pulpería necesita comprar agua, arroz, manteca, azúcar, café, pan, leche, frijoles, etc.  Ya que tiene poco mercadería y desea levantarla, con el apoyo del préstamo el dice que surtirá bien el negocio y venderá mas y por ende espera mejorar su calidad de vida.
Don Alexis su sueño seguir luchando para apoyar a su mamá porque es de mayor de edad.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2013.
texts.en:
Alexis, 45 years old, is single and lives with his mother in the community of San Lorenzo, Valle. During the last 20 years, he has been selling dry grains and soft drinks, while also working as a tailor.

Alexis is an engineer, but due to the lack of employment in his country, he runs a small grocery store and works as a tailor for his friends.  He wishes to get ahead with his income from his grocery store and his sewing jobs, to one day set up a nice tailor’s shop.

Alexis is requesting this loan to stock up his grocery store with water, rice, shortening, sugar, coffee, bread, milk, beans, etc. He wishes to increase his merchandise, to sell more and in this way, improve his situation.

His dream is to continue to work hard to support his elderly mother. 
San Lorenzo, Honduras, October 2013.

loans.use: to buy water, rice, shortening, sugar, coffee, bread, milk, beans, etc. to stock his grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Karamat

texts.ru: Карамат 66 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитала двоих детей, старший сын помогает по хозяйству и также занимается оказанием пассажирских услуг для местного населения, младший сын находится на заработках в России, помогает материально. У Карамат - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Карамат решила заняться животноводством, стартовав 18 лет назад с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Карамат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 4 овцы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Карамат обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Карамат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также мечтает улучшить условия проживания.
texts.en:
Karamat is a 66 year-old widow.  After her husband's death, she raised two children on her own.  Her eldest son helps with the housework and also provides transport services for the local population.  Her youngest son is a foreign worker in Russia, and is helping financially. Karamat has a secondary education. 

The primary source of income for her family is a livestock business, which she started 18 years ago with the purchase of a cow for 5,000 KGS. Through hard work, Karamat's farm now has three milk cows and four sheep. Her monthly income is 5,000 KGS. In order to grow her business, Karamat applied for a 100,000 KGS loan from microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners in order to purchase cows to raise and then resell on the market at a higher price. Karamat plans to invest the income from the loan to increase the number of domestic animals she owns, and hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cows to feed and resell

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Meet Salma. She is a 39-year-old from Jui, eastern area, in Freetown. She is married with three children.

In 2003, Salma established her general stock business. She began her business because she wants to empower herself.  She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Salma requires a loan in order to purchase more toothpaste, cream and soap to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. 

In the future, Salma plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more toothpaste, cream and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Isata is 22-old-single-woman from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She has one child.  In 2003, Isata established her retail business because she wanted to be independent.    She works at the business 10 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Isata requires a loan in order to purchase more cream and perfume to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to save money to attend a vocational training school and take care of her child. In the future, Isata plans to a secretary. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cream and perfume to expand her business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is a 48-year-old-married woman from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She has 3 children.  Fatmata established her retail business 15 years ago because she wanted to earn a living.    She works at the business 11 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is having insufficient capital to expand her business.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more cigarettes, biscuits and sweets to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Isata plans to expand her business even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cigarettes, biscuits and sweets to expand her business.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago de 50 años de edad, solo estudio hasta 6° grado,  debido a que su  papá murió y quedo solo con su mamá y para ayudar en los gastos del hogar tuvo que dejar la escuela. Esta casado y con su esposa venden fresco y panes, con ella procrearon 5 hijos; pero ya  se casaron cuatro y tienen su propia familia, solo uno vive con ellos y esta estudiando, en la casa solo su hijo su esposa y su mamá viven con él.    

Actual mente, Santiago se dedica  a  vender frescos y panes con su esposa, desde hace 2 años, antes de vender frescos trabajaba comprando chatarra; pero casi no le quedaba ganancia, luego comenzó a vender fresco empezó con 25 frescos y panes, pero cada día, fue aumentando hoy  tiene que hacer 200 frescos y 200 panes y para trasladarlos a donde los vende él compro un pick up viejo.  Luego los vende de casa en casa a pie, ellos se levantan a las 5: 00 AM, para comenzar a preparar el pollo para los panes, luego se trasladan donde los vende a las 11:00 AM, y regresan a las 4:PM así es su vida pero sueña con tener una tienda fuerte.            


El préstamo sera utilizado, para reparar  el vehículo que utiliza para llevar la venta al lugar donde los vende y el resto  lo invertirá en el negocio de panes y fresco.

Su sueño en un futuro, es comprar un terreno y construir su propia casa; pues hoy donde vive es de su mamá. Además, sueña ver a su hijo graduado en la universidad. De la ganancia espera ir pagando el crédito, para  dejar las puertas abiertas y en un futuro tener una tienda fuerte y ya no tener que vender de casa en casa sino en solo lugar.
texts.en:
Santiago is 50 years old and went as far as the sixth grade in school. This is due to the fact that his father died and he was left alone with his mother. To help with the household expenses he had to leave school. He is married, and he and his wife sell fruit drinks and sandwiches.  They have five children, but four of them are already married and have their own families; only one lives with them and is going to school. In the house it is only him, his son, his wife and his mother.  

Santiago and his wife have been selling fruit drinks and sandwiches for two years. Before selling fruit drinks he worked buying scrap but he earned very little, and later began to sell fruit drinks.  He started with 25 fruit drinks and sandwiches, but increased it little by little each day. Today he has to make 200 fruit drinks and 200 sandwiches, and to transport them to where he sells them he bought an old pickup.

Then he sells them from house to house on foot. They get up at 5:00 a.m. to begin preparing the chicken for the sandwiches, then at 11:00 a.m. they are brought to where he sells them, and they return at 4:00 p.m. This is how their life is, but he dreams of having a permanent store.

The loan will be used to repair the vehicle he uses for bringing his merchandise to the place where he sells it, and he will invest the remainder in his sandwiches and fruit drinks business. 

His dream for the future is to buy a piece of land and build his own home, as today the place he lives belongs to his mother. In addition, he dreams of seeing his son graduate from university. From the profits he expects to begin paying off his loan so that he can keep his business going, and in the future have a permanent store and not have to sell door-to-door but be in one place.

loans.use: To repair the vehicle he uses to bring the merchandise to the place where he sells it, and the remainder to invest in his fruit drinks and sandwiches business.

loans.name: Biakoye Group

texts.en:
The ‘Biakoye’ group is starting their third loan cycle with ID-Ghana and Kiva. The group is made up of seven members and it is represented by Agnes. Members engage in varied business activities which include product sales like lace clothing, fruit, underwear, fish and beans.

The loan they are requesting will benefit small business owners like Agnes(standing first from left in the photo). She joined 'Biakoye' one-and-a-half years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling fruits. She says she started this business on the advice of her parents. She travels to the village to buy fruits at a very reduced price and resell to customers.

She is requesting this loan to increase her merchandise and purchase more fruits to sell. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family since she is single with two children.

When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responded that she likes working with the group and the savings with the organization. 

They need a total loan amount of 3,800 GHS to increase their stock.

loans.use: to buy fruits at a very reduced price and resell to customers.

loans.name: Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de Mujeres Emprendedoras que lleva por nombre Luchadoras  se encuentra en el 1er. Ciclo del programa cuenta con 17 integrantes actualmente , es un Comité que empieza a desarrollar su capacidad de trabajar juntas y ayudarse todas, es un grupo muy responsable  y participan de las capacitaciones. 
Una de las historias dignas de destacar es el de la señora  Gladys de 60 años, ella pese a su edad , trabaja duro y comenta que se dedica a la venta de plantas en su casa, teniendo de esa forma un poco de ingresos, para procurarse un vejez digna y sin privaciones.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas variadas, y también de semillas y abonos. Ella está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
This group of enterprising women is called “Luchadoras” and is in its first cycle of this program.  There are 17 members and they have started developing their ability to work as a group and help each other.  It’s a very responsible group that participates in the training.

Gladys is 60 years old and works hard despite her age and says that she sells plants out of her home.  She earns some money this way so she can age with dignity.

She is asking for a loan to buy plants and also seeds and fertilizers.  She is very grateful for the opportunities she has gotten so she can continue to work.

loans.use: to buy plants and supplies.

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
Zulma es una persona muy trabajadora, que en conjunto con su marido trabajan y se esfuerzan por poder salir adelante y luchar. Comenta que este es su segundo crédito con kiva y que el anterior lo utilizo en la compra de prendas para la venta, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide de este nuevo crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas, como ser camisas, remeras, pantalones, jeans, y demás, con lo que podrá seguir estudiando. agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Zulma is a hardworking person and she and her husband work hard to get ahead.  She says that this will be her second Kiva loan and she used the previous one to buy clothing for resale, which helped her very much.

Today she is asking for a new loan so she can buy clothing, such as shirts, pants, jeans, and other things so she can continue studying.  She is grateful for this new opportunity.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: Jaime agradece a los inversionistas que le hayan apoyado con el crédito y se siente contento y desea continuar participando en el proyecto, él continua brindando servicio de transportes de carga en la ciudad de Pilcopata y continua en sus horas libres dedicándose a la agricultura, él sigue siendo un hombre emprendedor y trabajador  que saca adelante a su familia y continua siendo parte  del banco comunal “Paititi”, él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del moto carga.
texts.en: Jaime is grateful to the lenders that are supporting this loan. He feels content and wants to continue participating in the project. He still offers cargo transportation services in the city of Pilcopata and in his spare time he still farms. He continues as an enterprising and hard-working man who is getting his family ahead. He is a member of the “Paititi” communal bank. At this time he needs a loan to do maintenance on his cargo motorcycle.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his cargo motorcycle.

loans.name: Dilnoza

texts.ru: Дилноза молодая и целеустремленная женщина. Она не замужем и живет в отдаленном регионе вместе с родителями и братом. Дилноза умеет шить национальные женские платья. Она 5 лет назад начала свой бизнес. Она предоставляет свои услуги дома. Дилноза старается, чтобы ее клиентки были довольными. Ее клиентами являются не только ее соседи, но и женщины с других кишлаков. Дилноза и ее семья живут бедно. Ее брат не имеет постоянное место работы. Он хочет уехать в Российскую Федерацию. Дилноза хочет помочь своему брату, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки авиабилеты. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Dilnoza is a young and ambitious woman.  She is not married and lives in a remote area with her parents and brother. Dilnoza can sew national dresses. She started her business five years ago.  She provides her services from home.  Dilnoza tries to make her clients happy. Her clients are not only her neighbors, but also women from other villages.  

Dilnoza and her family live meagerly. Her brother does not have a permanent job and wants to leave to go to Russia. Dilnoza wants to help her brother, but doesn't have the money. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy air tickets. She awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to buy air ticket for her brother

loans.name: Diana Rosy

texts.es: Diana es originaria de la ciudad de León, tiene 23 años de edad. Casada y  estudiante de la carrera de Enfermería, que con mucho sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante y sobre todo mantenerse en pie con sus estudios. Su familia la apoya y ayudan para que pueda culminar su carrera, y cumplir con  sueño de ser una persona profesional exitosa. Es una joven  humilde y luchadora que tiene bien planificado sus metas y las estrategias para poder cumplirlas. Solicita un crédito  para pagar el curso de  titulación, con el fin de desempeñar en el mercado laboral con un título resguardado. Su plan es apoyar a su familia económicamente.
texts.en:
Diana is from the city of Leon, she is 23 years old, married and studies to be a nurse. With a lot of efforts she has managed to get ahead with her studies.  Her family supports her a lot so that she may complete her career and achieve her dream of becoming a successful professional. 

Diana is a very humble and hard working person, who plans her goals very well, as well as the strategies to achieve them. She is requesting a loan to pay for her nursing license course, in order to be able to practice once she will be a registered nurse. She plans to support her family financially.

loans.use: to pay for her nursing license course.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen is a mother of four children. Her husband owns a chicken shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase chickens from the farm to sell in the market. This is very important for him to continue generating income. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Yasmeen, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. Yasmeen is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase chickens to sell.

loans.name: Finda

texts.en:
Meet Finda. She is a 40-year-old from Jui, eastern area, in Freetown. She is married with three children.  

In 2003, Finda established her general stock business. She began her business because she wants to sustain her family. She works at the business nine hours per day and six days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Finda requires a loan in order to purchase more toothpaste, cream, soap and perfume to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children’s school fees and increase her business. 

In the future, Finda plans to open a foodstuff table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more toothpaste, cream, soap and perfume to expand her business.

loans.name: Amelia M.

texts.en: Amelia lives in the Ganta area and is a married 38-year-old mother with three children. The children are between 8 and 20 years old, attend school, and live at home. Her husband is a businessman.  Amelia stopped her education in the 9th grade. For the past five years, she has run a shop where she sells cold water. She started this business with money that she received from her husband. She is faced with the problem of buying gasoline and plastic bags since she uses the plastic to bag the water and the gasoline to run her generator to freeze the water. She makes more profit during the dry season. She is requesting a loan to purchase more gasoline, plastic bags to hold cold water, and other items.   These items will enable her to attract more customers.  She plans to build a house for her children and educate them.

loans.use: to purchase more gasoline, plastic bags to hold cold water, and other items.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 3 Group

texts.en:
Valentina is the group coordinator for Mujeres Unidas (United Women) 1 and 3. This group is located in Hato Mayor, a rural area in the Dominican Republic. Valentina lives with her long-term partner and her five children in a simple home in the rural village of Hato Mayor. The cacao harvest is one of the main economic activities in Hato Mayor. 

Valentina is an excellent Esperanza client and has successfully repaid 17 loans. With this 18th loan, she plans to buy fruit and cacao to sell in her community and to chocolate producers. Using the proceeds from her business, Valentina has been able to purchase clothing and food for her children. She has also repaired her house. Her dream for the future is to continue to educate her children and improve her house. Valentina thanks you for your support to help her achieve her goals!

loans.use: to buy fruit and cacao.

loans.name: La Esperanza 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Esperanza 2 está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y a poder salir adelante con su esfuerzo en conjunto. Ellas también forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza como una medio de poder conocer la situación de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Nancy, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir con ingresos medios, pero debe seguir trabajando por mejorarlos. Ella se dedica a la venta de bocaditos varios cubriendo además eventos, comenta que recibe muchos pedidos y que gracias a eso se ha hecho muy conocida con los demás clientes.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo los bocaditos que vende, y así cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes, ya que quiere comprar verduras, carne, harina, huevo, condimentos, etc. Esta agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe de seguir trabajando y mejorando su vida.
texts.en:
The La Esperanza 2 group is in its first cycle of the committee for women and the members are learning to work together to get ahead as a team.  They are also part of the program for the elimination of poverty as a means of getting to know each other’s situation.

Nancy is one of the members, who showed a level 2 poverty level in her last survey; that is to say with a medium income, but she must continue to work to improve it. She sells various types of snacks covering events and gets many requests.  Thanks to this she is well known by her other customers.

She is asking for a loan to be able to buy supplies so she can keep making snacks and meet her customer demand.  She wants to buy vegetables, meat, flour, eggs, condiments, etc.  She is grateful for the opportunity to continue working and improving her life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Gilma Teofila

texts.es:
Gilma tiene 50 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, la cual tiene una parcela agrícola en la cual trabaja desde hace 20 años para poder llevar un sustento a su hogar y poder salir adelante, ya que es madre de 6 hijos.

Gilma esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar fertilizantes, abono, entre otros y poder dar un mejor mantenimiento a su cultivo y poder tener una buena cosecha, así podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una mejor vivienda”.
texts.en:
Gilma is 50 and lives in the city of Pucallpa, where she has a plot of farmland that she's worked for 20 years. The farm has allowed Gilma to maintain her household and provide for her six children. 

Gilma is grateful to Kiva lenders, as their help will allow her to purchase fertilizers, manure, and other farming supplies. These inputs will help Gilma maintain her crops more effectively, increase the harvest, and result in higher income. This additional income will allow Gilma to keep pursuing her chief goal: "to have a better home."

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizer, and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Yoqubjon

texts.ru: Ёкубчон 45-летний парикмахер, проживающий в городе Исфара со своей женой, матерью и двумя сыновьями. Его жена занимается выращиванием скотов, мать пенсионерка, а двое сыновей уехали на заработки в чужие края. На протяжении 8 лет Ёкубчон предоставляет услуги парикмахера в собственной парикмахерской. Его услуги всегда пользуются спросом. Сейчас Ёкубчон планирует расшириться. Размер помещения его парикмахерской составляет 2,5x3,5. Ёкубчон просит кредит и хочет расширить помещение своей парикмахерской до 2,5x6, а также дополнительно купить парикмахерские кресла и инструменты. Ёкубчон любит свою профессию и ему нравится обслуживать людей. Расширив свой бизнес он также увеличит семейный доход. Он очень нуждается в данном кредите.
texts.en: Yoqubjon is a 45 year old barber living in the city of Isfara with his wife, mother, and two sons. His wife raises livestock, his mother is retired, and his two sons have left to work in other places. Over the course of eight years Yoqubjon has offered hair cutting services in his own barber shop. His services are always in demand. The size of his barber shop is 2.5mx3.5m He is asking for a loan to expand his shop to 2.5m x 6m, and also buy a barber's chair and tools. Yokubjon loves his work and likes to serve people. By expanding his business he will also increase his family's income. He is very much in need of this loan.

loans.use: To expand his barber shop and buy a barber's chair and tools.

loans.name: Safargul

texts.ru: Сафаргул уже давно была студенткой Медицинского колледжа. Она имеет медицинское образование. Сафаргул более 14 лет работает в местной больнице. У нее хорошие знания. Сафаргул выполняет свою работу честно и ее коллеги очень уважают ее. Сафаргул вдова и сама обеспечивает семью. Сафаргул с трудом справляется с семейными расходами, так как она получает маленькую зарплату. Сафаргул планирует отремонтировать свой дом, так как ее дом имеет плохое состояние. Сафаргул запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина, краски и т.п. для ремонта дома. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Safargul studied at the medical college quite some time ago, and has a medical degree. She has been working in a local hospital for over 14 years, and is very knowledgeable. Safargul is a responsible employee and her colleagues respect her. She is a widow and is the family's provider. It has been hard to match the family's expenses, since she makes a small salary. Safargul is planning to make repairs to her house, as it is in poor condition. She is asking for a 7500 somoni loan to buy building materials such as cement, lumber, paint, etc. for repairs. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood, and paint for repairing her house

loans.name: Bahry

texts.ru: Бахри добрая женщина. Она заботливая мать 3 детей. С целью того, чтобы получить доход и обеспечить своих детей со всеми необходимыми средствами, она 8 лет назад начала свой бизнес купле продажей топлива. Бахри продает топлива возле своего дома. Ее муж помогает ей введению бизнеса. Бахри в свободное время от своего бизнеса помогает своему мужу, который занимается ремонтом автомашин. Бахри хочет обеспечить своих детей лучшими условиями. Для реализации ее цели, ей необходимо получать больше дохода. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для покупки топлива для увеличения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Bahry is a kind woman. She is a caring mother of three children. Eight years ago, in order to earn an income and to provide her children with necessities, she started a business buying and selling fuel. Bahry sells fuel near her house. Her husband helps her develop her business. In her spare time, Bahry also helps her husband with his car repair business. 

Bahry wants to provide their children with the best possible living conditions. To achieve this, she needs to generate more revenue. She has applied for a a loan of $1,000 in order to purchase more fuel as increased working capital.  She awaits your generosity.

loans.use: To buy fuel for increasing working capital

loans.name: Zulma Imel

texts.es:
