Doña Zulma es una mujer de 46 años de edad la cual tiene un grado de educación de primaria completa y no pudo continuar porque a ella no le gusto el estudio y se dedicó a los quehaceres de su casa. Con el tiempo ella se casó formando un hogar compuesto por 4 hijos. Juntos trabajan en la preparación del cultivo de café y de los cuatro hijos que tienen tres viven con ella y uno ya se independizo involucrándose los tres hijos en las actividades de la producción de café. El primero de sus hijos tiene 25 años el solo llego hasta tercer grado ya que no le gusto el estudio y al paso del tiempo se casó y con su esfuerzo compro una propiedad y hoy está cultivando café él ya tiene un hijo y vive siempre en la misma comunidad pero en otro sector. El segundo tiene 15 años y este año sale de ciclo y tiene planeado y la fe en Dios de continuar con sus estudios y poderse preparar a nivel universitario. El tercero tiene 12 años y este año sale de primaria el cual tiene planeado para el próximo año seguir estudiando. El cuarto tiene 11 años el cual estudia en su quinto año de primaria. Desde niña trabaja la tierra ya que fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar posterior mente con el apoyo del esposo adquirió otros conocimientos requeridos y los ha aprovechado al máximo. 
Doña Zulma tiene como meta comprar más tierras para cultivar más café y mejorar sus ingresos económicos y de esa manera poder dejar una parte de tierra a sus hijos para que aseguren su futuro, para que puedan seguir estudiando y sean unos profesionales de éxito ya que ella no estudio quiere que ellos si logren para que les cambie la vida.
Por lo que hoy en día solicita financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas para poder asistir sus cultivos de café ya que la temporada está cada vez más cerca y necesita dar el mantenimiento y asistencia necesaria posible.
texts.en:
Doña Zulma is 46 and runs a coffee plantation. She only completed elementary school, before she decided that she didn't enjoy studying and turned her attention to household chores. When she grew up, Doña Zulma married and had four sons. Her oldest son is 25 and left school after the third grade because he also didn't enjoy studying. He married when he grew up, worked hard, and bought his own coffee plantation, where he works with his son. He and his family live in the same community as Doña Zulma, but in a different section. 

Doña Zulma's other three children live with her and help with her coffee crops. The second son is 15, has finished his middle school studies, and plans, with his trust in God, to continue his studies and prepare to enter a university. The third son is 12, has finished elementary school, and plans to continue studying next year. Doña Zulma's fourth son is 11 and is in the fifth grade. 

Doña Zulma has worked the land since she was a girl, when her parents taught her to farm. With the subsequent support of her husband, Doña Zulma has learned more about farming and has used this experience to the greatest advantage.  

Doña Zulma hopes to purchase more land to increase her coffee production and boost her income. This would allow her to leave part of her land to her sons and ensure their future so that they can continue to study and have successful, professional careers. Doña Zulma did not go to school for very long and wants her children to get the education that will change their lives.
 
She is therefore now applying for a loan to pay for the purchase of farming supplies to help her coffee crops. The coffee season is approaching and she needs to provide all possible support and maintenance for her coffee crops.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies that will allow her to raise her coffee crops.

loans.name: Edga Dalila

texts.es: Egda  tiene la edad de 32 años  nació en la comunidad de el manzano  ella estudio hasta 2do grado de primaria pues se le dificultaba ir a la escuela porque le ayudaba en los labores del hogar a su mama.Hoy en día ella ya tiene su propia familia  se caso con un  joven de la zona con el que tiene 3  hijos .Los niños van a la escuela de la comunidad ella comenta que  quiere que ellos se superen y aprendan ya que ella no tubo la oportunidad de hacerlo .Actualmente ella es  socia  de una pequeña cooperativa  que formaron entre lideres de la comunidad y se dedican a la explotación de camarones lo cual para ella es un ingreso que percibe ademas que como no le demanda de mucho tiempo  no le afecta en los labores de la casa , su esposo trabaja en siembra de maíz así que ambos trabajan y se apoyan. En la comunidad no tienen energía eléctrica es por eso que quiere este crédito para comprar un sistema solar para su casa y así  sus hijos puedan hacer sus tareas escolares ,jugar y otras actividades familiares
texts.en: Egda is 32 years old and was born in the community of Manzano.  She studied through second grade in primary school, but it became difficult to go to school because she helped her mother with work at home.  Today she has her own family and is married to a young man from the area.  Together they have three children.  The children go to school in the community and Egda comments that she wants them to get ahead and learn since she did not have the opportunity to do that.  Currently she is a member of the small communal bank that was formed by leaders of her community.  She works raising shrimp, which in addition to being additional income also does not demand a lot of time away from her responsibilities at home.  Her husband works growing corn and thus both parents work and support the family.  In the community they do not have electrical power, and for that reason she wants to use this credit to purchase a solar system for her home.  In that way her children will be able to do their homework, play, and complete other family activities.

loans.use: To purchase a solar power system for her home.

loans.name: Hellena

texts.en: Hellena is 31 years old and lives in Ganta. She is married with four children between the ages of 3 and 13. They attend school and live at home. For the past five years, she has been selling pepper and plantains in the local market. Hellena has a lot of customers and makes a lot of profit, especially during the Christmas season. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper and plantains for her business. She plans to expand her business and send her children to quality schools.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper and plantains for her business.

loans.name: Falastine Group

texts.en:
This group is called Falastine, which consists of four ladies. Mohsna is 36 years old and married with children. She lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She faces a bad situation, and her husband`s income doesn`t cover her family`s expenses. She has a small house which requires money to renew the house. So, she is requesting a loan from AMB that will help pay for construction supplies to renew her house. 

She hopes to own a retail shop to increase her profit. This will ensure a better future and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to renew her house.

loans.name: Raboniyat

texts.ru: Рабонияту 43 года. Она разведена и имеет одного ребенка. Рабоният работает в интернат школе в качестве уборщицы. Она получает маленькую зарплату, которая не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Рабоният живет бедно вместе со своим ребенком. Она даже не имеет кровать, стол и стулья. Она спит на полу. Рабоният хочет купить мебель и таким образом улучшить условию домохозяйства. Рабоният запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки мебели. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Raboniyat is 43 years old. She is divorced and has one child. She is working as a janitor in a boarding school. She earns a small salary which is not enough to provide for her family. Raboniyat and her child are poor. They don't even have a bed, table or chairs. She sleeps on the floor. Raboniyat wants to buy furniture and in so doing, improve the home's living conditions. She is asking for a 5000 somoni loan to buy furniture. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her house

loans.name: Shohruh

texts.ru: Шохрух добрый и целеустремленный человек. Он родился в 1974 года. Он женат и воспитывает прекрасных детей. Шохрух работает милиционером. Он честно выполняет свою должность. Шохрух работает с 8 утра до 5 вечера. Он работает 5 дней в неделе. Шохрух хочет купить компьютер для своих детей. Однако он не имеет достаточно денег. Шохрух запрашивает займ для покупки компьютера. Этот займ поможет ему обеспечить своих детей компьютером и таким образом развивать их технические навыки. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Shohruh is a kind and dedicated man. He was born in 1974. He is married and is raising beautiful children. Shohruh works as a policeman. He does his job honestly. Shohruh works from 8 am to 5 pm, five days per week.  

Shohruh wants to buy a computer for his children. However, he does not have enough money. Shohruh has requested a loan to buy a computer. This loan will help him to provide his children with a computer and thus develop their technical skills. He awaits your generosity and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to buy a computer for his children

loans.name: Bobokhon

texts.ru: Бобохон 42-летний пастух. Он проживает в селе Яванского района. Бобохон счастливый муж и отец, у него трое дочерей и трое сыновей. Сыновьям по 18, 10 и 8 лет, а дочерям по 15, 13 и 2 года. Бобохон вместе со старшим сыном занимается пастушеством. Жена Бобохона при дворе дома занимается выращиванием скотов. Остальные дети ходят в школу, кроме младшей дочери. Бобохон с детства занимается скотоводством. Сейчас он намерен увеличить поголовье своего скота. С этой целью он запрашивает кредит для закупа овец.
texts.en:
Bobokhon is a  42-year-old shepherd. He lives in the village of Yavan.  Bobokhon is a happy husband and father.  He has three daughters and three sons. His sons are eighteen, ten and eight years old, and his daughters are fifteen, thirteen and two. Bobokhon works as a herder with his eldest son. Bobokhon's wife works on raising cattle in the yard by their house. With the exception of the youngest daughter, all of the other children are in school. 

Bobokhon has worked in animal husbandry since childhood. He now intends to increase his livestock count.  To do so, he has requested a loan for the purchase of sheep.

loans.use: to buy sheep to increase his livestock count

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase five pigs to raise and three sacks of feed.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean, age 31, is happy tending her little store.  She is married with three kids. The store is her means of earning a living to support her family.  Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood, so she makes promising daily sales.  Jean keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores.  Jean believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Jean has reached her first year being a member to Paglaum MPC.  

She has applied for a loan of PHP 6,000 for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. 

She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. She is a hardworking mother, and wishes to sustain the store and from there provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods, noodles, beverages, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Salomon

texts.es:
Salomón de 60 años de edad, solo estudio hasta 6° grado debido  a la pobreza en la que vivía, ya no pudo seguir en la escuela; pero con todo eso agradece  a su papá, el esfuerzo que hizo con él. Esta acompañado y su compañera se dedica al quehacer del hogar, con ella procrearon 9 hijos pero solo están en casa  7, de ellos están estudiando 2, uno en la universidad y el otro en el instituto.

Él se dedica a la agricultura desde su juventud fue su papá, quien lo indujo al trabajo y siempre continua trabajando en la agricultura, de ese trabajo ha sacado adelante  a su familia. Además, siempre se dedica a la ganadería,pues debido a que no continuo estudiando no le toco de otra que trabajar en el campo, por eso impulsa a sus 2 hijos que sigan a delante. Sus hijos le  ayudan en la agricultura.     


El préstamo sera utilizado, para alquilar un terreno para sembrar maíz y la otra parte la necesita para pagar gastos en la universidad de su hijo y del que esta en el instituto.  

Su sueño  es ver a sus hijos graduarse en  la universidad, también sueña con comprar unas cuatro vacas, de la ganancias de la agricultura espera cancelar el crédito y dejar puertas abiertas para nuevos créditos y asi seguir cumpliendo su sueño.
texts.en:
Salomon is 60 years old and his highest level of education achieved was the 6th grade. He was not able to continue with his studies due to the poverty conditions in which he grew up. Despite this, he is very thankful to his father, for every effort that he did for him. 

Salomon lives with his wife, who takes care of the household work. They had nine children, and currently, seven of them still live at home; two of them are studying (one goes to college and the other one studies at an institute).

Salomon has been working in agriculture since he was very young, it was his father who introduced him to this field of work. In addition to agriculture, he is also a cattle farmer. This is how he has supported his family. He encourages his children to study, as he was not able to do it himself. His children help him with the work in the farm.

The loan that he is requesting will be used to rent a field to grow corn, and also, to cover some of the education expenses for his two sons.
His dream is to see his sons graduate with a university degree, and he also dreams with buying 4 cows. He will repay this loan with the income from the farm, enabling opportunities for future loans in order to continue to pursue his dreams.

loans.use: to rent a field to grow corn, and also, to cover some of the education expenses for his sons.

loans.name: Gladis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gladis de 43 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, debido a la situación económica muy mala en que creció, solo estudio quinto grado, tiene 30 años de experiencia en el manejo de ganado de repasto y la siembra de maíz, oficio que aprendió con sus padres, ya que era lo único que sabían hacer para poder subsistir.

 Todos los días lleva sus animales al potrero y después se dedica a las labores de limpieza, fertilización y otras actividades, para desarrollar bien su milpa.

Para comprar sus animales, aborda un autobús que pasa por su comunidad, viaja durante 30 minutos hasta llegar al tiangue, ahí se pasa casi todo el día, hasta encontrar animales a su gusto, después de comprar, los sube en un camión y regresa a casa.   

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 5 novillos de engorde en repasto. Podrá incrementar su hato, lo que permitirá que pueda realizar ventas mas continuas, lo que ayudara a dar una mejor condición de vida a su familia. 

Desea trabajar muy duro, para ahorrar y construir su casa de ladrillo, ya que vive en una de adobe.
texts.en:
Gladis is 43 and the single mother of three children. She only has a fifth-grade education because of her family's poverty, but she has 30 years of experience in raising livestock on pasture and planting corn. Gladis learned to farm from her parents, who didn't know any other way to earn a living.   

Gladis takes her herd to pasture each day and then takes care of cleaning, fertilizing, and other the other tasks required to raise an abundant corn crop.  

To purchase livestock, Gladis takes a bus that goes through her town and rides it a half-hour to a market, where she spends nearly the entire day looking for the cattle that she wants. After buying them, she takes the cattle back to her ranch in a truck. 

Gladis is applying for a loan from the Campo Foundation to purchase five heifers to fatten in pasture. The loan will allow Gladis to increase her herd so that she'll be able to sell cattle more frequently, generating more income that will improve her family's living conditions.  

Gladis wants to work very hard, to save, and to build a brick house, as she now lives in an adobe home.

loans.use: to purchase five heifers for fattening on pasture.

loans.name: Al-Majid Group

texts.en:
Al-majid is a group consisting of five ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. 

Hanan is a 33-year-old married woman who has children. She works hard and does her best to provide her family with food and clothing. She is a nurse who offers good services for patients, however, she gets a low salary, but she loves her career.  She lives with her family in bad conditions. She would like to complete her building, but she suffers from a lack of money. 

So she applied for a loan to buy construction supplies to use for building her house. 

In the future, she hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to build her house.

loans.name: Group 11 - Vĩnh Lập 01

texts.en:
Ms. Mau is 35 years old, is employed in agricultural production with a monthly income of approximately VND 700,000. She is single and lives by herself next to her sister's house. 

She has been a member of the Women's Union since 2000. She currently doesn't have a toilet at her own house, and has been using her sister's. 

With this loan, she can build a septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap to improve her living conditions, her health, and especially her personal safety and privacy as well as others in her community, while contributing to environmental health. 

In the picture, she is standing in the front row, second from the right.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Group 10 - Vĩnh Lập 01

texts.en:
Ms. Nhinh, 29, works in agricultural production with a monthly income of nearly VND 700,000. She is married with two little children. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 2009. 

Due to economic hardship, her family has not yet been able to build a septic tank latrine, and is using an unhygienic double-pit latrine which is now degraded. 

With this loan, she will be able to gain access to latrine hardware facilities which includes a hygienic septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap. 

Those facilities would also help her family improve their health, living conditions, and safety, particularly at night and during rainstorms, in addition to providing convenience, cleanliness, and privacy for all family members, while contributing to the environmental health of the community. 

In the picture, Ms. Nhinh is standing in the front row, first from the right.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Group 9 - Vĩnh Lập 01

texts.en:
Ms. Hue, 31, works in agricultural production with a monthly income of approximately VND 700,000. She is married with two little children. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 2008. 

Her family is currently using a double-pit latrine which is now degraded and is a health risk for her family members, her community, and the environment. 

With a portion of this loan, she will be able to build a hygienic septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap. 

Those facilities would also help her family improve their health, living conditions, and safety, particularly at night and during rainstorms, in addition to providing convenience, cleanliness, and privacy for all family members, while contributing to the environmental health of the community. 

In the picture, Ms. Hue is standing in the front row, first from the left.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Group 8 - Vĩnh Lập 01

texts.en:
Xuyền, 27, works in agricultural production with a monthly income of nearly VND 700,000. She is married with two little children. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 2009. 

Due to economic hardship, her family has not yet been able to build a septic tank latrine and is currently using a double-pit latrine which is now degraded. With a portion of this loan, she will be able to gain access to latrine hardware facilities which include a hygienic septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap. 

Those facilities would also help her family improve their health, living conditions, and personal safety (particularly at night and during rainstorms), in addition to providing convenience, cleanliness, and privacy for all family members, while contributing to the environmental health of the community. 

In the picture, Xuyền is the first from the right.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Kudrat

texts.ru: Кудрат умелый мастер по шитью женской одежды. Он этим делом занимается более 25 лет. Его навыки и умения развевались постепенно с годами. Сегодня он является одним из лучших мастеров по пошиву женской одежды. Он работает в центре города и имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Благодаря хорошему качеству работы и вежливого обращения с людьми, он имеет хорошую репутацию среди местного населения. Кудрат заботливый отец 4 детей. Он является основным кормильцем семьи, так как его жена домохозяйка. Он планирует отремонтировать свой дом, но не имеет денег. Кудрат запрашивает займ для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина, краски и т.п. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Kudrat is a skilled tailor of women's clothing. He has been in the business for over 25 years.  His skill and ability developed gradually over the years. Today he is one of the best women's tailors. He works in the city center and has many regular customers. Thanks to the high quality of his work and his courteous manner with people, he has a good reputation among the locals. Kudrat is the caring father of four children. He is the family's sole provider since his wife is a homemaker. He is planning to do some remodeling in his house, but doesn't have enough money. He is asking for a loan to buy building materials such as cement, lumber, paint, etc. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood, and paint for repairing  his house

loans.name: Group 7 - Vĩnh Lập 01

texts.en: Ms. Yen, 27, is married with two little children. Yen and her husband work in agricultural production with a monthly income of about VND 1,300,000. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 2007. Her family is currently using a double-pit latrine, which is now degraded. With a portion from this loan, she will be able to pay for construction of a latrine hardware facility, which includes a hygienic septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap. Access to this facility will help her family improve their health, living conditions, and personal safety, particularly at night and during rainstorms for her two small children. In addition, it will provide convenience, cleanliness and privacy for all family members, while contributing to the environmental health of the community. In the picture, Ms. Yen is standing in the front row, first from the right.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Group 4 - Vĩnh Lập 01

texts.en:
Ms. Hien, 44, works in agricultural production with a monthly income of approximately VND 700,000. She is the group leader of loan Group number 4, including 10 households of Vinh Lap commune, Thanh Ha District. She is married with two children who are attending high-school. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1995. Her family and other members of the loan group currently do not have septic tank latrines, and they are still using degraded double-pit latrines. 

With the loan of VND 10,000,000 per person, Ms. Hien and other group members will build a septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap to improve their living conditions, in addition to providing personal safety, convenience, cleanliness and privacy for all family members, while contributing to environmental protection. In the picture, she is standing in the front row, second from the right.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Group 3 - Vĩnh Lập 01

texts.en:
Ms. Yen, 43, works in agricultural production with a monthly income of approximately VND 720,000. She is married with two children who are studying at high-school. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 2001. Her family currently does not have a septic tank latrine and is using a double-pit latrine which is now degraded. 

With a portion of this loan, Ms Yen will build a septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap to improve the living conditions as well as the health of her family members, in addition to providing personal safety, convenience, cleanliness and privacy for all family members while contributing to environmental protection. In the picture, she is standing in the second row, first from the left.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Group 2 - Vĩnh Lập 01

texts.en:
Ms. Loi, 55, works in agricultural production with a monthly income of about VND 680,000. She is married with two grown-up children and has been a member of the Women's Union since 2002. Her family currently does not have a septic tank latrine and are still using a degraded double-pit latrine. 

With a portion of this loan, Ms. Loi will build a septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap to improve her family's living conditions, in addition to providing personal safety, convenience, cleanliness and privacy for all family members while contributing to environmental protection. In this picture, she is standing in the front row, first from the right.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Sheraly

texts.ru: Шерали трудолюбивый человек. Он родился в 1962 года. Он женат и имеет 4 детей. Шерали работает в государственной организации водителем. Он получает каждый месяц зарплату, но это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Шерали и его семья живут в старом доме, где невозможно жить. Он срочно должен отремонтировать свой дом. Шерали не имеет денег, чтобы купить строительные материалы. Он запрашивает займ для покупки строительных материалов как краски, цемент и т.п. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Sheraly is a hardworking person. He was born in 1962, is married, and has four children. He works for a government agency as a driver. Each month he receives his salary, but the salary is not enough to support the family in all its needs. Sheraly and his family live in an old house which is nearly uninhabitable. He needs to do repairs right away, but doesn't have the money to buy building materials. He is asking for a loan to buy construction materials such as paint, cement, etc. He awaits your kindness and thanks you for your charity.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as paint and cement for house repairs.

loans.name: Sharofiddin

texts.ru: Шарофиддин добрый и начитанный человек. Он родился в 1975 года. Шарофиддин женат. Его дети еще не имеют источника дохода, поэтому он является основным кормильцем семьи. Шарофиддин после окончания университета поступил на работу в государственное учреждение. Он до сих пор работает в государственном учреждении. Шарофиддин хочет купить мягкую мебель для своего домохозяйства, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ для покупки мебели. Шарофиддин ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sharofiddin is a kind and well-read man. He was born in 1972 and is married. His children do not yet have their own sources of income, so he is the sole provider for the family. After graduating from university, Sharofiddin began working for a government agency, where he still works now. He wants to buy soft furniture for his household, but doesn't have the money. He is asking for a loan to buy the furniture. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy furniture for household

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita is 62 years old, married and a resident of Oroquieta-Buenavista, Philippines. To earn an income, she engages in a buy and sell business. Juanita has been a member of PMPC for two years and enjoys its membership privileges. Now she is applying for a loan of 11,000 PHP to restock her inventory. Expansion of inventory would mean an increase of income, from which she can sustain the needs of her family. All she wants for her family is to have a decent and comfortable life with adequate income from her business. Juanita deeply wishes to remain a member in good standing with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative.

loans.use: to restock inventory for her buy and sell business.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is married with one child. Mary Joy is 29 years old and lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay.

Mary Joy operates her own sari-sari store to earn a living and had this business for 8 years. Each month, she earns PHP 50,000 doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of PHP 49,900 to have additional capital.

Mary Joy has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Mary Joy hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jenemir

texts.en:
This is Jenemir, 31, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Jerry, an engineer, and is a mother of three children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jenemir operates a printing business. She mainly offers signboards, sticker boards, tarpaulins and other printed materials used in business establishments, schools and others of the like. They buy their materials and supplies for printing and manufacture different printed materials that their customers require. Her regular customers are business owners, students and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy supplies like bond paper, ink, printer and other materials needed for her business. 

Jenemir dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for supplies like bond paper, ink, printer and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Mariechu

texts.en:
Mariechu is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending and e-loading (mobile prepaid load) businesses. Mariechu is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store.

Mariechu has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Group 6 - Vĩnh Lập 01

texts.en:
Ms. Nguyet, 28, works in agricultural production with a monthly income of approximately VND 630,000. She is married with two little children. Ms. Nguyet has been a member of the Women's Union since 2007. Her family is now using a double-pit latrine which is degraded and has the risk of potentially adverse affects to the health of her family members, her community and the environment. 

With a portion of this loan, Ms. Nguyet will be able to purchase the materials to build a septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap. This would help her improve the living conditions, the health, personal safety, privacy of her family members and also contribute to the environmental health of the community. In the picture, Ms. Nguyet is standing in the front row, the second from the right.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Group 5 - Vĩnh Lập 01

texts.en:
Ms. Tam, 54, works in agricultural production with a monthly income of about VND 700,000. She is married with two grown-up children. Ms. Tam has been a member of the Women's Union since 1984. Her family currently does not have a sanitary latrine. 

With a portion of this loan, she will be able to gain access to latrine hardware facilities which include a hygienic septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap. Those facilities would also help her family improve their living conditions, provide a safe location for them to defecate, particularly at night and during rainstorms, in addition to providing convenience, cleanliness and privacy for all family members, while contributing to the environmental health of the community. In the picture, she is the fourth from the right.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 33 years old; a married mother with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Maribel has a fishing business in the Philippines. Maribel requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Maribel has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Maribel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Ma. Regina

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Ma. Regina works hard to support her family.

She has a soft-drinks retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from E-loading (mobile prepaid load). Ma. Regina is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of soft drinks to sell.

Ma. Regina has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is 56 years old and married with four children. With three children currently in school, Visitacion works very hard to provide for them.

Visitacion runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store. Visitacion has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, noodles, coffee, sugar, and cooking oil. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Roma

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Roma works hard to support her family. She has a coffee shop business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fishing. Roma is borrowing 9,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her coffee shop.

Roma has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her coffee shop.

loans.name: Vevencia

texts.en:
Vevencia is 64 years old and married with six children. She is in the agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. Vevencia requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies.

Vevencia has been farming corn for 14 years now and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina nació en la ciudad de Itahuania y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. (La comunidad de Itahuania está ubicada dentro de la provincia de Manu en el departamento de Madre de Dios, Perú). Alejandrina tiene 50 años y tiene una relación unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos, ella se dedica  a la agricultura, venta de comida y crianza de animales menores. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia pues ella pertenece al banco comunal “Paititi”. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras y comestibles. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Alejandrina was born in the city of Itahuania, and she lives in the same city that she was born in.  (The Itahuania community is in the Manu province, Madre de Dios department, Peru).  

Alejandrina, age 50, is in a common-law marriage, and they have six children.  She is a farmer, sells food, and raises small animals.  She has been in this business for several years, and it is going very well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.

She is an enterprising and hard-working woman who gets her family ahead.  She belongs to the “Paititi” communal bank.

She now needs the loan to buy vegetables and groceries.  She appreciates and values the loan.  She pledges to make her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and groceries.

loans.name: Liberato

texts.en:
Liberato is a native man from the town of Alicia, Bohol. He is married and runs an assorted household items store. He is also engages in farming. He tills the land and grows rice to help augment the income of their household. He is asking for a loan to buy more stocks for his store and fertilizers for his farm.

In the future, Liberato would like to expand his business and increase business profitability for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more stocks for his store and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Romelie

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Romelie works hard to support her family. She has a coffee shop business in the Philippines. Romelie is borrowing 9,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy sugar, coffee, and milk for her coffee shop business.

Romelie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, and milk for her coffee shop.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 30 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Michelle has borrowed and repaid eleven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from e-loading (mobile prepaid load). 

Michelle aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Jenelly

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Jenelly works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a restaurant. Jenelly is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.

Jenelly has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can rent a space at the public market.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Juacinta

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Juacinta works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Juacinta is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish-vending business.

Juacinta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine is married with two children. She is 30 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Kristine operates her spare parts store to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns 25,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 49,900 PHP for additional capital to buy more items to sell. Kristine has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Kristine hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her spare parts store.

loans.name: Meylin Patricia

texts.es: Meylin tiene de 25 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Malpaisillo, León.  Soltera y estudiante de último año de la carrera de Tecnología Médica, es una joven emprendedora que con mucho sacrificio ha luchado por salir adelante. Sus padres le  han brindado lo mejor, para que ella sea una profesional exitosa y cumpla su mayor sueño de culminar sus estudios universitarios. Solicita financiamiento para poder pagar su curso de titulación, con el fin de obtener la licenciatura de su carrera y poder desempeñar sus labores empresariales ya como una profesional. Su plan es poder  regresarles a sus padres toda la ayudan que le han dado, ya que ellos le han dado ese apoyo para que sea una persona con éxito.
texts.en:
Meylin, age 25, is from the city of Malpaisillo, León.  She is single, and she is in her last year of her Medical Technology studies.  She is an enterprising young woman who, with a great deal of sacrifice, has struggled in order to get ahead.  Her parents have provided her with the best so that she will become a successful professional and fulfill her biggest dream, which is to complete her university studies.

She is requesting a loan to be able to pay for licensing and registration requirements so that she may practice her profession.  Her plan is to be able to give back to her parents all of the help they have given her.  They have given this support so that she will become a successful person.

loans.use: to pay for licensing and registration requirements.

loans.name: Misael Mauricio

texts.en:
Misael has always dreamt of becoming a mining engineer. Misael was accepted into the Universidad Mayor de San Andrés and now with the chance to achieve his dream is concerned about affording his graduation fee. He plans on graduating in March, 2014 but without a loan from Vittana he thinks that he may need to take time off to work and save until he can return to school. 

Misael plans on using the loan to cover the cost of his graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in mining engineering before graduating. Misael currently works 30 hours a week and earns $3 a day. One of his biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With a degree in mining engineering he expects to earn $25 a day. 

Unfortunately, Misael's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without the opportunity for a higher degree, his parents never had the chance increase their earning power. Growing up, Misael's family's finances were always tight. With two older siblings attending college already, Misael is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Johan

texts.en:
Tech savvy and entrepreneurial, Johan owns and operates a computer and cell phone repair service. After working out of his home for a year, he opened up a storefront in Perth Amboy, New Jersey. As he was getting his store ready to open up, disaster struck. 

Hurricane Sandy caused incalculable damage and forced Johan to delay his grand opening. Luckily, after three months and lots of effort, he finally opened; however, the damage to his livelihood and his community still lingers.

Johan continues to rebuild his business and the Perth Amboy economy, and he believes this loan will help him to do that. He will use this loan as working capital and to promote his services in the local community.

loans.use: To use as working capital and promotion of tech repair start-up

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 62 years old and married with five children.

Margarita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Margarita has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 18 years and also earns an income from a restaurant.

Margarita aspires to save money to expand her business and improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Mary works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling jewelry in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Mary is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more jewelry to sell to customers.

Mary has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Ediltrudes

texts.en:
Ediltrudes works hard to support her family. Ediltrudes is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Ediltrudes requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients and materials like bananas, sugar, bamboo sticks, etc. for her business.

Ediltrudes has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Ediltrudes would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and materials like bananas, sugar and bamboo sticks for her business.

loans.name: Dianelys

texts.en:
Cuba native Dianelys came to the United States over 15 years ago. After spending some time as an employee of a distributor of medical supplies, Dianelys wanted to use her insider’s knowledge of sales and customer relations in the industry to make a name for herself.

That’s when South-Med Services was born. Dianelys’s two-year-old business services beauty and cosmetic clinics that turn to her for the distribution of medical supplies.

Dianelys is proud that she is the face of her own business and is overwhelmingly satisfied with how she has managed to create good and lasting relationships with her clients.

This working mother envisions a bright future for South-Med Services: She wants to eventually open a store-front, expand her inventory, and hire more employees.

But before she gets on her path to expansion, Dianelys needs your help. With this loan she will purchase a new computer and enhance her marketing efforts by creating a catalog that details her complete list of services.

loans.use: To purchase a new computer and enhance her marketing efforts.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 52-year-old woman from Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

In order to survive and sustain their family, Susan and her husband engage in rice and corn production to earn a living. Her family has been in this business activity for more than 20 years already as their main source of income. 

Susan became an active member of Paglaum MPC with good credit standing. She enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative, and now she wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of 10,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP). This loan is intended to purchase farm inputs and pay labor costs in cultivating the land for rice and corn production. She dreams of nothing more than having a happy and healthy life with her family and an adequate income from her business.

Susan deeply wishes to remain a member in good standing with PMPC, and she repays her obligations in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and to pay labor costs for cultivating the land

loans.name: Isidro

texts.en:
Isidro is 45 years old and lives in Brgy. Minsubong, Tangub City. He is married with one child.

Isidro has a sari-sari store (variety store) and earns approximately PHP (Philippines Pesos) 3,000.00 each month doing this type of business. He has a requested a loan to add to his capital. 

Isidro is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Isidro hopes to improve his livelihood in order for him to provide more services for his clients.

loans.use: to buy new items for his sari-sari store

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander has worked in the courier business for most of his life and his messenger and courier services business, Now Courier, has been in operation since 1998. 

Now Courier serves all of Florida, helping customers deliver documents to places like law firms and medical offices. Alexander’s low prices and fast service have produced loyal clients for Now Courier. He has clients that have been using his service for his entire 15 years in business and he says that one of his greatest successes is earning his customers’ trust.

Alexander hopes to eventually expand his business from a one-man operation to a fleet of vehicles and one day make Now Courier “bigger than UPS or FedEx.”

Help this New York native accomplish his goal by contributing to his loan goal. With your help, Alexander will be able to wrap his company car with his logo, thereby marketing his service as he drives around Florida.

loans.use: to pay for marketing for his business.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
When Anthony was a child, his father, who has been a painter for 20 years, would bring him to work, and even back then Anthony remembers really enjoying watching his father and helping him with the painting work.

Now, after 8 years of painting exteriors and interiors, Anthony, who specializes in decorative exterior and residential painting, wants to start his own painting business. 

This family man has one employee: his father, who introduced him to his passion for painting, and he will rely on this business to support his wife and three children. “I want to provide that secure foundation for them for when they get older so I can put them through college and let them do the things I wasn’t able to do growing up.”

With this loan, Anthony will get the funding he needs to start up his business. He will purchase a new paint sprayer, get insurance, get licensed, and market his painting business in local Orlando, FL papers.

Check out his company here: http://anthonydaidone430.wix.com/daidonepaintingco.

loans.use: to purchase equipment, get insurance and a license, and market his business

loans.name: Remelyn

texts.en:
This is Remelyn, 32, resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Roel, a pedicab driver, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Remelyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one packet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells burgers for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP (Philippines Pesos) 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Remelyn hopes to be successful in her business and dreams that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 66 years old and married with nine children. Editha works very hard to provide for them.

Editha runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Editha has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and school supplies. 

In the future Editha would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Joelka Maria

texts.es: Joelka tiene 28 años de edad, es originaria de la ciudad de León. Soltera y estudiante de la carrera de Administración de Empresa, en la cual se encuentra en su último año. Su mayor sueño es culminar su carrera y poder apoyar a su familia, sus padres la apoyan en sus estudios. Solicita el crédito para poder pagar su curso de titulación y graduarse de su carrera, con el fin de cumplir el sueño de ser una profesional completa y exitosa. Su plan es desempeñar un cargo en un empresa y efectuar sus conocimientos obtenido, y teniendo como respaldo su título de graduada.
texts.en:
Joelka, age 28, is from the city of León.  She is single, and she is in her last year of her Business Administration studies.  Her biggest dream is to finish her studies and to be able to support her family.  Her parents support her in her studies.

She is requesting a loan to be able to pay for licensing, registration, and graduation requirements.  She will do this in order to fulfill the dream of being a complete and successful professional.  Her plan is to take on a role in a company and putting her attained knowledge to use, having her degree as her endorsement.

loans.use: to pay for licensing, registration, and graduation requirements.

loans.name: Reseda Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Reseda  está en el 3er. Ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, es un grupo muy emprendedor y que fueron creciendo de apoco, y con una expectativa de salir adelante por medio del trabajo de cada una.
Ramona es parte de este grupo, y con mucho esfuerzo está creciendo y mejorando su vida y las condiciones de su familia. Es modista y una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora. Su sueño es poder ir creciendo y poder dar a otras personas trabajo y así servir de ayuda.
Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos, para poder cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes. Agradece por esta oportunidad que ellas y sus amigas están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The group named "Reseda" is in its third loan cycle with the Women Entrepreneurs Program. This enterprising group is growing a little bit at a time and has the expectation of moving forward through the work of each member.

Ramona is part of this group and is putting forth great effort to keep growing and to improve her life and the conditions of her family. She is a seamstress as well as a hardworking and determined individual. Her dream is to continue growing and to provide other people with work that will be helpful to them.

Ramona is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of fabrics and thread, which will enable her to complete her customers' orders. She is grateful for the opportunity that she and her friends have received.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread used in sewing.

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es: Sabino tiene 62 años de edad, tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos y vive en la ciudad de Itahuania. (La ciudad de Itahuania está ubicada dentro de la provincia de Manu en el departamento de Madre de Dios, Perú). Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura y la venta de madera y tambien él tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde cosecha plátano, yuca, coca, piña y otras frutas tropicales.  Ya son varios años que se dedica a la negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, él es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que pertenece al banco comunal “Paititi”. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Sabino, 62, lives in a free union, has two children, and resides in the city of Itahuania in Manu province in the department of Madre de Dios, Peru. He mainly farms and sells lumber. He has several plots of land on which he grows bananas, yuca, coca, pineapple, and tropical fruits. He has been in business for years and believes his hard work has made the business prosper. 

Sabino is enterprising and hardworking. He belongs to the communal bank Paititi. He needs a loan to buy fertilizer. He is grateful for and values the loan and promises to make his monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Unido De Suretka Group

texts.es: Jennifer es integrante de Banco Mujer Unido de Suretka, con apenas 20 años de edad es madre de dos niños pequeños y tiene 4 años de vivir en unión libre. Ella es avicultora, inicio la actividad ya que se vio en la necesidad de colaborar con la economía familiar ya que el ingreso mensual de su compañero es muy poco, este es su cuarto crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, alimentos, vitaminas, además de un congelador para vender los pollos ya limpios y listos para consumir. Los créditos anteriores le permitieron iniciar el negocio y consolidarlo. Tiene sus metas bien definidas y de las más importantes seguir estudiando para en un futuro tener mejores ingresos. Junto a Jennifer están 6 socias mas que van a invertir en actividades comerciales y agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Jennifer belongs to the communal bank Mujer Unido de Suretka [United Women of Suretka]. She is just 20, is the mother of four young children, and has lived in a free union for four years. She keeps bees, a trade she took up after realizing she needed to help pay household expenses, as her companion's monthly income is low.

This is her fourth loan cycle, and she will use the loan to buy chicken, food items, vitamins, and a freezer where she can keep the chickens fresh and ready for customers. She used her previous loans to start and build her business. She has definite goals, the most important of which is to keep studying so that her income rises in the future. Jennifer and six other members are going to invest in commercial and farming activities.

loans.use: to buy chicken, food items, vitamins, and a freezer.

loans.name: Señor De Coyllorytti De Ccorao Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE COYLLORYTTI DE CCORAO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Ccorao, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Felipa ella es casada ,tiene 55 años y tiene 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades  diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas entre otros, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez se dedica a la venta de verduras ,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes y alimento para su negocio.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de venta de animales, negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, picantera y negocio de venta de artesanía.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “Señor de Coyllorytti de Ccorao,” which is in the Ccorao district of Cusco province in the department of Cusco. Felipa, 55, is a member, is married, and has three children. She spends her days doing household chores and raising small animals like guinea pigs and hens. She raises these animals to sell to customers who order them. This has been her trade for some time, and she believes her daily effort has made the business prosper. She also sells vegetables and wants to keep working to support her family.

Felipa has applied for a loan to buy guinea pigs and feed for her business. The other members businesses are: selling animals, selling vegetables, running a grocery store, serving traditional food, and selling handicrafts. Felipa thanks those who share her dream through this institution and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and feed for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: Doña Rosa es originaria de la ciudad de Managua, madre de tres hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería, el cual le ha logrado mantener establemente.  Esta agradecida con Kiva y Micrédito ya que le ha permitido tener un negocio próspero y variado.  Solicita un nuevo crédito para la compra de: gaseosas, arroz, jabón entre otros, con el fin de brindar una diversidad en sus productos. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que incrementara sus ventas y podrá cumplir con la demanda de su clientela.
texts.en:
cDoña Rosa is originally from the city of Managua and the mother of three children. She is a merchant who manages a grocery business that has remained stable.

Rosa is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito since their assistance has allowed her to have a prosperous and diversified business. She is requesting a new loan in order to buy sodas, rice, soap, and other products so that she will have a variety of products. Rosa predicts that this loan will be of great help since it will increase her sales and allow her to satisfy the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy sodas, rice, soap, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 54 years old and married with three children.

Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Evelyn has borrowed and repaid twenty-one loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from frozen foods.

Evelyn aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 39 years old and married with one kid.

Catherine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP [Phillippines pesos] loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Catherine has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Catherine aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Crisantos Javier

texts.es: Crisantos Javier 46 años de edad acompañado con tres hijos menores de edad y aun bajo su responsabilidad, originario del municipio de Chinandega, se dedica a la venta de servicios de transporte de carga pesada, es propietario de dos camiones, los cuales ocupa para realizar viajes de cosechas de maní, caña de azúcar, y cosechas de agricultores de la zona de occidente, también realiza viajes a particulares, trabaja con clientes fijos y en algunas ocasiones con clientes eventuales, conoce de este negocio debido a que el trabajo como ayudante después trabajo en su vehículo particular y poco a poco su negocio fue crecido hasta obtener dos camiones grandes, uno de sus sueños es poder ver crecer a sus hijos y convertidos todos en unos profesionales ya que el no logro llegar ni a la secundaria, otro es poder ver crecer aun mas su negocio. el objetivo de este crédito es para comprar de dos llantas nuevas para sus unidades de trabajo y asi garantizar el buen funcionamiento de sus unidades a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Crisantos Javier is 46 years old, and he has three young children that are still under his care. Originally from the town of Chinandega, Crisantos sells his services transporting heavy cargo. He is the owner of two trucks, which he uses to transport crops of peanuts, sugar cane, as well as the crops from farmers in the western areas. 

Crisantos also makes private trips, working with fixed clients, and sometimes for occasional clients. He knows about this business because of his work as an assistant, then he worked in his own vehicle. Bit by bit his business grew until he got two large trucks. 

One of Crisantos's dreams is to be able to see his sons grown up and transformed into professionals, as he did not even make it to high school. Another dream of his is to keep expanding his business. The objective of this loan is to purchase two new tires for his work units, thus ensuring the smooth running of his units to clients.

loans.use: buy two new tires.

loans.name: Verónica Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña verónica quien habita junto a su esposo,  en un barrio de Managua, labora como dependienta de una farmacia, con sus ingresos se apoya con los gastos del hogar, en la actualidad está haciendo un pequeño anexo a su vivienda, ya que esta es muy pequeña por lo que desea culminar esta ampliación para poder apoyar a su hija brindándole un espacio en su hogar, ella es casada pero aun no tiene hogar propio. Verónica Solicita el crédito para  comprar los materiales de construcción y poder terminar esta obra que ha venido haciendo por etapas debido a sus bajos ingresos económicos, gracias al financiamiento podrá comprar los materiales siguientes: perlines, cemento, bloques, hierro, arena, y laminas de zinc, de esta manera podrán tener más espacio y disfrutar de comodidad.
texts.en:
Verónica lives with her husband in Managua and works as a salesperson in a pharmacy. She uses her income to help pay household expenses. She is building an addition to her house because it is too small for their needs. She wants to finish the addition so that her married daughter has a space in the house, as she doesn't have her own house yet.

Verónica has applied for a loan to buy construction materials to finish the project, which has been done in stages due to her low income. Thanks to this funding, she will be able to buy beams, cement, blocks, iron, sand, and laminated zinc so that she has more space and can be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy beams, cement, blocks, iron, sand, and laminated zinc.

loans.name: Raquel Evangelina

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Rocafuerte. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive La señora Raquel, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene una hija la misma que ya es mayor de edad y casada pero aun viven con ella, junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Su esposo trabaja en el mercado de la ciudad. 
Doña Raquel se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y zapatos, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene unas vitrinas para exhibir su mercadería, sus clientes  le realizan pedidos ya que los productos que ella vende son de muy buena calidad. Trabaja todos los días en las noches y los fines de semana todo el día, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  se la traen de  Guayaquil, lleva con su negocio 12 años y siempre le ha ido muy bien.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, ropa de niños y zapatos. Lleva en el Banco Comunal por 8 años  y le gusta porque los créditos le son de gran ayuda  en su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Rocafuerte Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Rocafuerte settlement.  This place is known all over the country for its delicious sweets prepared by the local people.

Raquel lives here.  She is 58 years old, married, and has an adult daughter.  She is married but still lives with her, along with her husband and two children.  Her husband works in the city market.

Raquel sells all types of clothing and shoes door to door and from her home, where she has some display cases to show her products.  She takes orders from her customers because she sells good quality products.  She works every evening and all day on the weekends, sells on credit, and collects every two weeks.  She brings her merchandise from Guayaquil and has had her business for 12 years.  Things have always gone well for her.

She will use the money from this loan to buy pants, shirts, children’s clothing, and shoes.  She has been with the communal bank for eight years and she likes it because the loans are of great help to her business.  Her dreams are to continue ahead.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Ravshanoy

texts.ru: Равшаной трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 33 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет двоих не совершеннолетних детей. Дети еще не ходят в школу. Муж Равшаной плотник. Равшаной более 8 лет работает в государственном учреждении уборщицей. Она хотела работать в более высокой позиции, но так как она не имеет высшее образование, она не смогла найти подходящею работу. Равшаной мечтает, чтобы ее дети получили высшее образование и работали в управляющих должностях. Она старается обеспечить своих детей со всеми необходимыми средствами. Равшаной планирует отремонтировать свой дом, который имеет плохое состояние. Равшаной запрашивает займ для покупки строительных материалов. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Ravshanoy is a hardworking woman.  She is 33 years old, married, and the mother of two children who are still young and not going to school yet.  Her husband is a carpenter.  For more than eight years now, Ravshanoy has been working as a cleaning lady in a public institution.  She wanted to work in a higher position, but since she doesn't have a higher education, she couldn't find a suitable job.  Ravshanoy's dream is to see her children receive a higher education and have management positions.  

She tries to provide all of life's necessities to her children.  She is also planning to repair her house, which is in poor condition.  To do so, she is requesting a loan to purchase building materials.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy building materials to repair her house.

loans.name: Nubia Josefa

texts.es: Nubia es originaria de  Chichigalpa en esta comunidad vivió hasta la edad de 16 años  después se caso y se traslado a vivir con su esposo a la comunidad de san remigio  de este matrimonio ha procreado 5 hijos sus hijos varones ya están casados y sus dos hijas mujeres aun viven con ellos y estudian ellas viajan los fines de semana hasta la ciudad para estudiar un técnico en enfermería, comenta que se siente muy feliz ver que sus hijos y hijas son personas de bien educadas  y con buenos valores. Ellos  se dedican a los labores de siembra de maíz y la crianza de animales como gallinas que usan para consumo del hogar y también venden a los pobladores de la zona ademas de percibir otros ingresos de una sociedad que tienen con una pequeña cooperativa de explotación de camarón. En la comunidad aun no llega la energía convencional por las noches hacen uso de candelas o phocos con baterías para iluminarse , es por eso que ahora quiere hacer este tramite de crédito para comprar un sistema solar e instalarlo en su vivienda para mejorar la condición de vida de toda la familia .
texts.en:
Nubia is originally from Chichigalpa.  She lived in this community until she was 16.  After that she got married and moved to live with her husband in the community of San Remigio.  This marriage has produced 5 children.  Her sons are already married and her two daughters still live with them and study.They travel on the weekends to the city to study to be a technician at a nurse's office.  

She says she is very happy to see that her sons and daughters are well educated persons and have good values.  In addition to working by planting corn and raising animals such as hens which they use for food at home as well as selling to the people in the area they also get receive income from a group involved with a small co-op that has a shrimping operation.

Conventional energy has not yet arrived in the community.  At night they use candles or battery-powered flashlights for light, and it's for this reason that now she was to request this loan to buy a solar energy system and install it in her home to improve the condition of life for the whole family.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. She is widowed and selling firewood in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a 16,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of wood to sell.

She has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of wood to sell.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leonora is 67 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Leonora has a fishing business in the Philippines. Leonora requested a 11,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan amount through NWTF to buy additional equipment and gear for fishing.

Leonora has been in this business for 13 years. Leonora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment and gear for fishing

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 49 years old and a married mother of four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Evangeline has a business selling firewood in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a 6,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of firewood to sell.

Evangeline has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Edna

texts.en:
Ma. Eda is 47 years old and married with three children. Ma. Eda works very hard to provide for them.

Ma .Eda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 23,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ma. Eda has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, noodles, bread and other groceries. 

In the future, Ma. Eda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres trabajadoras está en su primer ciclo  del programa de comité, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, y participando del programa de eliminación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Claudia,  quien se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo está saliendo adelante. Tiene como meta poder crecer y salir adelante y así poder ayudar a su familia. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas de verano, ya que se acerca el calor y quiere poder tener buena variedad de prendas que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
"Mujeres Trabajadoras" (Women Workers) is in its first loan cycle with the committee program. All of the members have promised to work together and help one another so that they can move forward. They have taken a poverty elimination survey and are also participating in a poverty elimination program.

One of the members is Sra. Claudia, who sells various types of clothing. She has made many sacrifices and is striving to get ahead. Her goal is to grow and move forward so that she can help her family. Claudia is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of summer clothing. Since the warm season is approaching, she wants to have a wide variety of clothes that she can offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy a variety of summer clothing to sell.

loans.name: Clemente

texts.es:
Clemente tiene 56 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de San Juan de Bigote, su población se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganadería, a una hora de la ciudad e Morropon, que se ubica en la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y chivos en la parte posterior a su domicilio y comercialización de granos maíz, frejol, soya, etc, sus hijos y esposa le apoyan en esta labor, son conocidos en la zona ya que distribuyen sus productos por los caseríos aledaños a su comunidad.

El ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para construir una granja de cerdos y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes y así generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Clemente is 56 years old. He lives with his wife in the district of San Juan de Bigote, whose population is engaged in commerce, agriculture and animal husbandry. It is one hour from the city of Morropon, which is located in the city of Piura, on the northern coast of Peru.

He makes a living raising pigs and goats in the back of his home, and selling grain, corn, beans, soybeans, etc. His wife and children support him in this work. They are well known in the area, as they distribute their products throughout the homesteads surrounding his community.

He has requested a loan of 2000 nuevos soles to build a pig farm. This way he will have a better production to offer customers, and he will generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to build a pig farm.

location.town: San Juan de Bigote - Morropon - Piura

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
