loans.name: Zulma Milagros

texts.es:
Zulma tiene 32 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, y para poder salir adelante trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, Zulma trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes; Zulma cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable con sus clientes y sobre todo ofrece productos de calidad a precios cómodos.

Zulma esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le están brindando podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como olos, shorts, vestidos, entre otrosy de esta manera pueda mejorar sus ingresos y poder luchar para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Zulma is thirty-two years old. She lives in the city of Ica, and she has a small business selling clothing to get ahead. Zulma works around nine hours a day and she can attend up to as many as fifteen customers; Zulma believes that her business is going well because she is friendly to her customers, and above all, she offers quality products at convenient prices.

Zulma is grateful for Kiva lenders since thanks to the help they're giving her, she will be able to buy merchandise for her business such as tee shirts, shorts, and dresses, among other things; in this manner, she can increase her income and be able to strive to realize her greatest dream: to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (tee shirts, shorts, and dresses, among other things)

loans.name: Jane Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jane Elizabeth tiene 49 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Nueva Arica, en una zona rural, donde su población se dedica al cultivo de manzanas, ciruelas y otros frutales, comercio y ganadería a una hora cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral en la parte posterior a su domicilio, Jane nos explica que se dedica a esta actividad para poyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para comprar animales pequeños para posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos a mejor precio en los caseríos aledaños a su comunidad.
texts.en:
Jane Elizabeth is 49 years old, living with her partner in the district of Nueva Arica. They live in a rural zone where the population cultivates fruits such as apples and pears; as well as ranching and other forms of commerce. It is a drive of one hour and forty five minutes to the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Perú.

Jane Elizabeth raises and sells domesticated birds in her backyard. She explains that she does this work to help her husband with the family expenses.

She has requested a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) to purchase small animals which she will fatten and offer at a higher price. She will sell them in the surrounding neighborhoods of her community.

loans.use: to purchase small animals which she will then fatten for sale.

loans.name: Martha Luz

texts.es:
Gracias por apoyar a Martha, quien con su credikiva logró comprar maíz, harina de trigo, pollo, carne, y cerdo, con los cuales preparó sus deliciosos productos que vendió.
Martha pide a sus financiadores que sigan apoyando a los microempresarios, para lograr cumplir sus metas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva nuevamente, con el cual planea producir para la demanda que  usualmente se presenta el fin de año y para ello requiere comprar en mayor volumen, su materia prima, como carne, pollo, embutidos, enlatados, aceitunas, harinas, especias, que harán de su credikiva una inversión rentable, pues rotarán rápidamente sus productos y aumentaran sus ingresos, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Martha, who with her Kiva loan was able to buy corn, wheat flour, chicken, beef, and pork, which she used to prepare the delicious products that she sells.

Martha requests that her lenders continue supporting small business owners, so they can achieve their goals. She is currently requesting a new Kiva loan, with which she plans to produce for the demand that usually comes up at the end of the year. In order to do this, she needs to buy her raw materials in larger quantities, such as beef, chicken, lunch meats, canned foods, olives, flour, and spices, which will make her Kiva loan investment profitable. Her products will sell quickly and this will increase her income, making her Kiva loan investment successful.

loans.use: to buy her raw materials in larger quantities, such as beef, chicken, lunch meats, canned foods, olives, flour, and spices.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen, 53, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Julian and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household as she works hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Helen has a stall where she cooks and sells grilled foods such as fish and pork. People in the community sometimes just choose to buy foods that are already cooked to save time. This kind of stall is normally located in front of the house of the seller or at a block to be easily seen. She also sells it per order. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 900 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products such as fish, pork, charcoal and different ingredients for grilling.

Helen dreams of expanding her business and hopes that her family will have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more quantities of products such as fish, pork, charcoal and different ingredients for grilling.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
This is Estrella, who is 53-years-old and a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married and has children. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Estrella operates a soft drink business. She orders large quantities of different soft drinks from suppliers and then sells them in her store. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.
To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more bottles of different soft drinks.

Estrella dreams that her business will continue to expand and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more bottles of different soft drinks.

loans.name: Natalie

texts.es:
Natalí  de 28 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de productos de tocador cremas corporales, colonias, fragancias, productos para niños y cosméticos en general; Ella aprovecha cada temporada del año, para vender y se ajusta a los requerimientos de productos de su clientela para hacer que su inversión tenga éxito, mientras ella gana dinero. 
Natalí es una mujer casada, madre de dos hijas en las edades de 9 y 11 años; como en la medida que ellos crecen,  los ingresos de su cónyuge, no son suficientes, para apoyar su bienestar y sus sueños. Esta fue la razón por la cual acudió a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará cremas capilares, y productos alimenticios, a propósito de la navidad, como  galletería, carnes frías, entre otros. Con ello aprovechará  una vez mas, la temporada de fin de año, en la cual se incrementan los gastos de sus clientelas, comprando estos productos, lo cual ayuda a que Natalí  gane un poco más, que en cualquier otra época del año. Su tarea diaria la realiza desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche y de lunes a domingos, con el fin de lograr mas adelante cumplir su sueño de prosperidad, que el de tener su propia casa lo que generaría mayor estabilidad familiar.
texts.en:
Natalí, 28, makes a living selling toiletry products such as body creams, colognes, fragrances, children's products, and cosmetics. She takes advantage of the different seasons to sell and adjusts her product offerings for her customers so that her investment will be successful and she will earn money.

Natalí is a married mother of two daughters ages 9 and 11. As her girls are growing, her husband's income is no longer enough to support their well-being and dreams.

For this reason, she is requesting a Kiva loan. This is her first financing with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With the loan, she will buy hair products and food products for the Christmas season such as cookies, frozen meat, and more. With this, she will be able to take advantage of this season at the end of the year, which will increase her sales to customers who buy her products. This will help Natalí earn a more than any other time of the year. Every day, she works from 8 in the morning until 7 at night from Monday through Sunday. Her goal is to move forward and achieve her dream of prosperity, which includes having her own home to provide her family with more stability.

loans.use: to buy hair products and food products for the Christmas season such as cookies, frozen meat, and more.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es:
Dionicio  tiene dos hijos , vive en casa propia la misma se encuentra ubicada en la Comunidad Arajllanga provincia Aroma.
Dionisio estudio hasta el nivel primario. Se dedica a la elaboración de queso junto con su esposa, quien aparece en la foto.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de alimento (Afrecho) para así poder cumplir con sus requerimiento y venta de queso.
El sueño de Dionicio  es que su ganado tenga suficiente alimento porque no va poder cumplir con sus obligaciones si el ganado no está  en buenas condiciones para así poder tener mejores ingresos.
Es el segundo que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA
texts.en:
Dionicio has two children. He lives in his own home home which is located in the Arajllanga community in the Aroma province. Dionisio has only completed elementary school. He makes his living in the manufacture of cheese with his wife, who appears in the photo.
The loan is required to purchase feed (bran) so his cows can get their fill and sell cheese. The dream of Dionicio is that his cattle have enough food because he will not be able meet his obligations if the cattle are not in good condition. This will allow him to have better income.
This is his second loan he has requested with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase bran and feed for their cows, so they are well fed and can produce good quality milk for cheese production.

loans.name: Americo Jose

texts.es: Americo está agradecido por el préstamo a todos inversionistas que creyeron en él, él desea  continuar participando en el proyecto, él socio sigue viviendo en la ciudad de Salvación junto con su familia, él también continua con la compra y venta de madera y sigue siendo parte del banco comunal “Tesoritos del Manu” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más  madera. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en: Americo is grateful to all the investors who believed in him for the loan that he received. He wants to continue participating in the project. He continues living in the city of Salvación together with his family. He also continues to buy and sell wood and continues to be part of the communal bank "Tesoritos del Manu." At this time he needs the loan to buy more wood. He appreciates and values the loan and promises to make his monthly payments

loans.use: to buy wood to sell

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana vive con su hijo en casa de su su tia en un acabado de fino y piso de machimbre en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz. El oficio que desempeña es de empleada. Susana necesita el crédito para la compra de material de construccion, comprara cemento, ladrillos, fierros y otros, para la construcción de una habitración más y de esta manera ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.

El sueño de Susana es poder tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Susana lives with her son in her aunt’s home, which has finished walls and a wood floor, in the Pasankeri area in the city of La Paz. She works as an employee. Susana needs the loan to purchase construction materials. She will buy cement, bricks, iron bars and other items to build one more room. In this way she will provide her son with a better quality of life.

Susana’s dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks, iron bars and other items to add one more room to the house where they live in order to make her son more comfortable.

loans.name: Luci Marcia

texts.es: Marcia esta agradecida por el apoyo brindado y se siente muy feliz de ser parte de este proyecto, ella continua viviendo en la ciudad de Salvación y continua con el negocio de la venta de abarrotes como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite y otras cosas, ella sigue teniendo su pequeño local en su domicilio donde expone sus productos. Ella continua participando en el banco comunal “Tesoritos del Manu” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en: Marcia is grateful for the support she was provided and she feels very happy to be part of this project. She continues living in the city of Salvación and she continues with her business selling groceries, such as rice, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, and other things. Her small store is still in her house, where she exhibits her products. She continues to participate with the “Tesoritos de Manu” communal bank, and at this time she needs a loan to buy merchandise, such as, for example, sacks of rice, noodles, and other things. She appreciates and values the loan and she pledges to comply with her monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as sacks of rice and sugar, noodles, and other products.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feeds, medicines and two more pigs for her hog raising business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.es: La Señora Emma de 18 años de edad vive en Colomi, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo pequeño. Percibe ingresos por la venta de fruta que adquiere de los productores de Villa Tunari. Con experiencia de 1 año en el comercio, tiene un puesto de venta en el cual trabaja los días de feria. Actualmente requiere un crédito como capital para ampliar su comercio de fruta y de esta forma incrementar sus ingresos para mantener a su hijo y pagar sus estudios.
texts.en: Emma is 18 years old. She lives in Colomi. She is a single mother and has a small son. She has income from the sale of fruits that she obtains from the growers in Villa Tunari. With 1 year of experience in commerce, she has a sales stand where she works on market days. She currently needs a loan for capital to expand her fruit business so she can increase her income to provide for her son and pay for his studies.

loans.use: to expand her fruit business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en: Carmen helps her husband in operating their fishing business to make a living. She has been doing this activity for six years earning well for the family. She joined GDMPC in 2008 and successfully repaid her previous loan used in repairing their fishing boat. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to buy additional fishing net. She wants to improve the general living situation of her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is married with six children living in the village of Mobod in Oroquieta City. She helped her husband earn an income with her manufacturing business, making and selling polvoron in town. She also offered it in the school canteen for sale. She has been doing this for two years and hs been able to supplement their daily needs. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy raw ingredients for making polvoron (a cookie-like snack food). She is hopeful and determined to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making polvoron

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en: Ofelia is a mother who is blessed with three children. Due to financial difficulty, she aims to improve her variety store in order to increase her income. Now, she plans to acquire more stocks of grocery items to sell but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy more stocks of soft drinks, mineral waters, shampoo, beverages, junk foods, and corn to sell. Through her hard work and determination, she knows that she will make her business more profitable and be able to satisfy her customer demand.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of soft drinks, mineral waters, shampoo, beverages, junk foods, and corn to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is running a dressmaking service in her community while her husband in earning income from employment as carpenter. She personally cut fabric and sews it according to orders and customer demand. She also accommodates made-to-order curtains. With these activities, she earns well for their living. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional fabrics and materials for dressmaking. She is hopeful to gain more revenue from her investment and able to save for the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fabrics and materials for dressmaking

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
This is Ma. Theresa. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy feed and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 60,000 PHP loan to buy feeds and supplies like dog food, cat food, medicine, chicken food, cage, shampoo and other supplies needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.



Ma. Theresa dreams that her business will last longer and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.



* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feeds and supplies like dog food, cat food, medicine, chicken food, cage, shampoo and other supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Marelie

texts.en: Marelie is 22 years old and married with one child as can be seen in the picture. Marelie works very hard to provide for them. Marelie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to resell in her general store. Marelie has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as cooking oil, sugar, soy sauce, cereals, milk, coffee, dried fish, etc.  Marelie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to resell in her general store.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene works hard to support her family. Arlene is married and has a fruits and food vending business in the Philippines.

Arlene requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruits and ingredients for her business.

Arlene has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is asking for a loan because he believes that through it he will improve his business. The previous loan enabled him to save money from his charcoal business. In addition to the charcoal selling business, he also operates a cafe where he prepares various foods. 

Patrick is requesting for a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase food ingredients such as maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and meat for his business. He feels that he was able to make a good investment with his previous loan, which to date has allowed him to maintain his level of profits to help his family cover their personal expenses.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients such as maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and meat for his business.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Catalina works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling vegetables and fruits in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from food vending and farming vegetables. Catalina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables, fertilizers, and other farm supplies for her business.

Catalina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables, fertilizers, and other farm supplies for her business

loans.name: Cerelina

texts.en:
Cerelina is 57 years old and single. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Cerelina has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Cerelina has been in this business for 3 years. Cerelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Gowa

texts.en:
Gowa is asking for a new loan because she believes that through it she will improve her business. The previous loan enabled her to to save money for her charcoal selling business. 

Gowa is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to purchase sacks of charcoal for her business. She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Njira

texts.en:
Njira is a married woman with six children, three of whom attend school and three are adults. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past five years, she has operated a kiosk business selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 100,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, bananas, soft drinks, rice, cereals, and coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, bananas, soft drinks, rice, cereals,and coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married with five children, all of whom attend school, which is the reason for her hard work.  She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. 

Fatuma has operated a cafe business making consumables like rice, tea, beans, chapatti ( flat bread) for sale to passers-by and neighbors.  She cited seasonality as a major challenge.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase stocks of goods such as maize flour, wheat flour, rice and drinks for the business. Her dream is to see her children get a better education and become important persons in society.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of goods such as maize flour, wheat flour, rice and drinks for her cafe business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa appreciates for her previous kiva loan that improved her living standards.
She is requesting for a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase onions, tomatoes, potatoes, and other vegetables for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, potatoes, and other vegetables for resale

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria es una mujer muy empeñosa; vive con su tres hijos en la zona de Los Pinos  ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.  Se dedica principalmente a la administracion de alquileres de dos departamentos.  El esposo fallecio ya hace tiempo. La Sra. Roxana  necesita el credito para hacer la compra de material para el arreglo del piso de su domicilio y pago de un albañil; esto para el mejoramiento de su vivienda y poder alquilar y generar ingresos y asi poder hacer frente a los gastos que tiene en su hogar.

El sueño de la Sra. Maria es poder tener mayores ingresos en base al sacrificio que hace su familia, y poder tener una vejez tranquila, espera poder ver a sus hijos ya profesionales y con un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Maria is a perseverant woman. She lives with her three children in the Los Pinos neighborhood in the city of La Paz. She works mainly in the administration of renting to apartments. Her husband passed away some time ago. Roxana needs a loan to buy material for fixing the floor of her house and to pay a construction worker. This is so that she can improve her house and then rent it so she can generate income so she can meet her household expenses. 

Maria’s dream is to have better income as a result of the sacrifices made by her family, and to have a tranquil old age. She hopes to see her children become professionals with a better future.

loans.use: to buy materials to fix the floor of the house where she lives and to pay a construction worker.

loans.name: Norberta

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose a la ganadería y al negocio de venta de leche, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende sus ganados en las distintas ferias que se realizan por la zona a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo  de esta forma que la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para continuar apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca pequeña.
La socia se siente agradecida con el crédito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Norberta continues working on her farm and selling milk. She has been in this business for years and it has gone very well for her due to the determination she brings to her work each day. Norberta sells cows to customers who approach her in the different festivals that are held in her area. She is a responsible and determined woman. Being this way, she hopes to be able to keep working in order to continue supporting her family. 

Norberta is requesting a loan in order to buy a small cow. She is grateful for this loan and pledges to make all of her repayments.

loans.use: to buy a small cow.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Angeles works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Angeles is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy more items like noodles, sardines, snack foods and other groceries for her general store business.

Angeles has been sustaining her business activities through her past 31 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like noodles, sardines, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.es:
Victoriano  es un hombre agricultor de 37  años de edad.  El está en unión simple junto a su esposa  y  vive en Sololá.  El tiene tres hijos  varones  ellos estudian en una escuela de la comunidad y lo apoyan en el campo en tiempos libres.

El se dedica a la agricultura cultivando cebolla, papa y zanahoria  en parcelas que tiene  a pocos metros de su casa, esto lo aprendió de su padre desde que era pequeño, porque él lo apoyaba en el campo de la agricultura y ese fue su primer trabajo.
El cuenta con quince  años de realizar su propio cultivo y ser independiente viendo que obtiene ganancias buenas cultivando estas verduras. De este modo el solicita un préstamo de Q 4,000.00 para compra de semillas de papa y fertilizante, para cultivarlo y cosecharlo mejorando sus ingresos junto a su familia. 
El sueña con expandir su cultivo en otras parcelas y darles estudios académicos a sus hijos para mejorar las condiciones de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Victoriano is a 37-year-old farmer. He and his domestic partner live in  Sololá. He has three sons who study at the local school and help him in the fields during their free time.

He cultivates onions, potatoes and carrots in lots which lie a few meters away from his home. He began learning this business from his father when he was small, because helping his father in the fields was Victoriano's first job. Seeing the good earnings he could make, he began independently cultivating his own fields ten years ago. He requests a loan of 4,000 Quetzales to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer, to plant and to improve the harvest which will increase his family's income.

Victoriano dreams of expanding his production into other plots of land and of giving his sons the opportunity to study, which will improve the living conditions of his entire family.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 48-years-old and married with four children.

Fe works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Fe has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns additional income from retailing charcoal.

Fe aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 35 years old and a mother of seven children. She is living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband Saleem is a green grocer by profession and he has sold fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and Saleem does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales out of the vegetables.

Therefore, Razia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy excess seasonal vegetables. Saleem thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh and seasonal vegetables.

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en:
This is the first loan for Nasira; she assured us that she will pay all installments on time because she wants to take another loan in the future. 
She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
Nasira is a 24-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She requested a loan for her husband’s fruit selling business. Her husband owns a fruit shop and participates in household expenses. He likes to sell seasonal fruits.  Now he wants to buy bananas in large quantities to sell because its season is going on and its price is very low.
Therefore, she requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner so that her husband can buy bananas in bulk. She hopes that this loan will prove productive for her and she will save a reasonable amount soon.
Nasira is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits, like bananas, to sell.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 53 years old, married, and has 3 adult children. She lives in Landing Baliangao Misamis Occidental. Tessie is engaged in vegetable gardening,  a business which is located in her backyard. She has been in this business for many years and earns a monthly income of 5000 PHP. She is also known for her pedicure and manicure business, which earns a weekly income of 500 PHP. 

Tessie has been a member of Paglaum since 2000 and has never made any defaults as she makes payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of fertilizers and pesticides for vegetable gardening.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 36 years old. She is married and has four children in grade school and high school. Her husband is a farmer and a laborer at the same time. She lives in Tugas Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. Catherine is engaged in animal sales business, such as pigs, chickens, and goats. She earns 3,000 PHP a month out of this business.

She requested a new loan to purchase materials used for building pig pens for her pigs and buy three additional heads of pigs to raise. She is really striving to sustain her living so she can be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase three heads of pigs and various materials for building pig pens.

loans.name: Amerlyn

texts.en: Amerlyn is single with two children, helping her neighbor, Jocelyn, in making polvoron (shortbread cookies) for sale. She sells cooked polvoron in school, and she earns good enough for her children's needs. She also offers it in stores in their village with a percentage or discount to the store owners. She is hopeful to improve her business and be able to offer it in the market in town.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients for making polvoron(shortbread cookies).

loans.name: Madeline

texts.en:
Madeline is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a butcher shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy livestock to butcher and sell in her food stall.

Madeline successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Madeline's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to butcher and sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Erlinie

texts.en: Erlinie is married with five children.  She runs a general store, while her husband is farming, to make a living. She has been in this business earning well enough to provide allowance for her children to attend school.  She joined GDMPC and requested a  loan to purchase more grocery items for sale. She is hopeful to sustain her store for a stable source of income aside from farming.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for sale.

location.town: San Roque, Rizal Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Dilida

texts.es: Hace 11 años que Dilida, mujer de 34 años de edad,  inició su negocio de peluquería,  una vez terminó un curso técnico en este oficio, mediante el cual se preparó para ofrecer servicios de mejoramiento de imagen personal; ella a prendió a cortar, desrizar, peinar cabello,  hacer tratamientos capilares,  entre otras tareas, y en un local ubicado en su propio domicilio empezó su idea emprendedora. Su negocio poco a poco ha ido creciendo y su meta es consolidarlo aun más, porque tiene como sueño principal hacer mejoramiento de las condiciones de su vivienda. Su oferta la hace de contado, y compra los insumos y materiales en el centro de la ciudad donde encuentra proveedores especializados que le ofrecen precios competitivos. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Sano Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una secadora profesional, máquina de corte de cabello y otros implementos de belleza, además de productos capilares. Con estas nuevas herramientas, su negocio queda como nuevo y ofrecerá un servicio de mucha más calidad y hará que sus clientes regresen cada vez más, lo cual hace de su credikiva una inversión de éxito.
texts.en:
Dilida is 34 years old. She started her hair salon business 11 years ago, once she finished a technical course in the trade, which prepared her to offer services that improve self image. Dilida learned to cut, to straighten, and to do hairstyles and hair treatments, among other tasks. This entrepreneurial idea began in a store located in her own home. Her business has been growing little by little and her goal is to strengthen it even more, because her main goal is to do improvements of her housing conditions.

Dilida makes offers in cash and buys supplies and materials downtown where she finds specialized providers that offer competitive prices. She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, and it is her first time financing with the Fundación Mario Sano Domingo, which will allow her to buy a professional hair dryer, hair clippers and other beauty appliances, as well as hair products. With these new tools, her business will be like new and will offer a much higher quality service, which will make her clients continue to return, making her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: buy a professional hair dryer, hair clippers, and other beauty appliances, as well as hair products.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan of ksh. 40,000 to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 30 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Flordeliza is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Flordeliza has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from an E-loading (mobile prepaid) business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet works hard to support her family. Juliet is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Juliet requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients, such as vegetables, spices, meat, seasonings, etc. for her food production business.

Juliet has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Juliet would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients, such as vegetables, spices, meat, seasonings, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 38 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. Sandra works very hard to provide for them.

Sandra runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Sandra has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as shampoos, sardines, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future, Sandra would like to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell to customers.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 54 years old and married with one child. Emma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more goods to sell.

Emma has borrowed and repaid two previous loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns income from clothing sales. Emma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Ledesma

texts.en:
Ledesma works hard to support her family.  Ledesma is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Ledesma requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.  She has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Ledesma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Meerim

texts.en:
I feel happy and excited about attending the American University of Central Asia (AUCA). Every person has her own dreams, wishes, and things that she wants to achieve. I think that AUCA is the leading university in Central Asia that can provide a quality education. I know there are many interesting clubs and sections which help students to find new friends, to get new skills in the organization of social events, and to become a successful person. AUCA will help me to advance my knowledge.

But there can be difficulties in all endeavors. Unfortunately, there is one difficulty. My parents can’t afford to pay full tuition fees. But my desire to study, to become a successful person, and to become a useful specialists for my country exists and nothing can destroy it. Moreover, there is an opportunity given to AUCA students, which is a Kiva loan. I hope that I will receive a Kiva loan so that I could fully commit myself to studies.

I think this is a huge help for students who want to continue their studies. I am very happy that my parents support my intention to study at AUCA because it is very important. I am sure that AUCA will give a high-level degree to become successful and realize all my plans for the future. AUCA gives lots of opportunities to its students, one of which is a loan. I would like to take an opportunity and also apply for a Kiva loan. The loan will help me to cover my tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for my higher education.

loans.name: Altynai

texts.en:
Altynai is a student of AUCA and here is her story.
“When there is a time to choose a University and faculty there are many questions, but I knew from the very beginning what my goal was and gradually came to it. Starting from my childhood, I watched TV programs and repeated them, even though did not know that it was a profession of journalist. Year after year, I started to explore the world of journalism and I began to like it more and more. It is very difficult to explain what it means to me to be a journalist, but the most important thing is to be informed and share information with people all over the world. Because there are lots of interesting things happening in daily life journalists convey them to the people through TV, internet, radio, newspaper and magazines. Hence, journalists make our life more colorful and more interesting.
AUCA is one of the best universities of Central Asia, not only our country. In addition the teaching methods are very modern and the university atmosphere is very cheerful and friendly, that’s not all at the end of studying at AUCA students will fluently speak not only English, but also several languages which helps AUCA graduates to find best jobs.
My choice was influenced by New Generation Academy of AUCA. With the help of this program, I changed my views about AUCA. I am very grateful for a chance to become part of NGA, which gradually changed my life. 
AUCA gives another opportunity, it gives a loan through KIVA, which is great opportunity for all the students to cover their tuition fees. So, taking an opportunity I am also applying for KIVA loan, which will help me to cover my tuitions.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Noelia

texts.es: Noelia nació en la provincia de Pilcopata pero vive en la ciudad de Salvación. (La ciudad de Salvación está ubicada en el distrito del Manu en la provincia de Manu dentro del departamento de Madre de Dios, Perú), ella tiene 25 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene un hijo, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante su familia y su actividad económica principal es la venta y compra de fruta como por ejemplo plátanos, piña, naranjas y otras frutas tropicales. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y ve la muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Tesoritos del Manu” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo manzanas, cocona, maracuyá y otros. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en: Noelia was born in the province of Pilcopata, but she lives in the city of Salvación. (The city of Salvación is located in the district of Manu in the province of Manu, which is in the department of Madre de Dios, Peru.) She is 25 years old and married. She has one child as a result of her wonderful marriage. She is a hard-working and enterprising mother who helps her family to get ahead. Her main job is selling and buying fruit, such as bananas, pineapple, oranges, and other tropical fruit. She has already had the business for several years and it is going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She belongs to the communal bank “Tesoritos del Manu” (Little Treasures from Manu) and needs the loan on this occasion in order to purchase more merchandise, such as apples, coconas [native to the Andean region of South America], and passionfruit. She is grateful for the loan and appreciates it, and she promises to comply with the monthly repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise, such as apples, coconas, and passionfruit

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de leche, agricultura y venta de leña, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a sus negocios los cuales le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a cada uno de ellos, la socia vende de forma ambulatoria la leche a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma poder seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche y madera.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: This member still works buying and selling milk, farming, and selling wood.  She has been working at these businesses for some time, and they are doing well due to the determination that she brings every day to each of them.  She works as a traveling merchant, selling milk to customers who request it.  She is a responsible and diligent person who wants to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family. She is requesting a loan to buy milk and wood.  She is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with her payment plan.

loans.use: to buy milk and wood.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose a la ganderia, la socia cría a sus vacas para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan en las distintas ferias que se realizan por la zona, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo  de esta forma que le socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca.
La socia se siente agradecida con el crédito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues to make a living from ranching. The member breeds her cows and later sells them to clients who request them at the various fairs put on in the area. The member has been in this business for a while and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. The member is a responsible and diligent person who helps her family to get ahead in life.

The member is requesting the loan in order to purchase a cow.

The member feels grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Selene

texts.es:
La socia Selene sigue dedicándose al negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, también sigue dedicándose a la compra y venta de leche, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes y alimentos para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: This member, named Selene, continues to work at her business raising small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens, among others. She has been working at this business for some time, and it is doing well due to the determination that she brings to it every day.  She also works buying and selling milk.  She wants to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family.  She is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs and animal feed for her business. She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and animal feed for her business.

loans.name: Lilian Marlene

texts.es:
La Señora Lilian está realizando su segundo crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito El Arenal. Vive por el hermoso sector de San Joaquín en Cuenca, lugar que es reconocido por sus carnes asadas, también sus tierras son muy fértiles donde se cosechas una gran variedad de hortalizas. Le gusta su grupo de crédito porque le dan la oportunidad de compartir entre amigas ya que en días normales no se puede y salen de su rutina diaria de trabajo.
La Señora. Lilian tiene 49 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos es casado  vive en su casa y comparte los gastos de la casa, otro trabaja le ayuda con los gastos de la casa y también estudia en la Universidad, su último hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad, su esposo labora como empleado público, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Lilian tiene un de belleza desde hace 18 años, ella es todo una profesional y la experiencia le ha permitido ampliar sus conocimientos, aprovecha su negocio para vender a sus clientes cosméticos, ropa en catalogo y también productos naturales. 
El dinero de su crédito es para comprar tintes de cabello, ropa y cosméticos. Su meta es que sus hijos sean emprendedores e inicien y crezcan en algún negocio.
texts.en:
Lilian is requesting her second loan with her friends and colleagues from El Arenal Group.  She lives in the beautiful San Joaquín area of Cuenca.  The area's known for its grilled beef and fertile land where many vegetables are grown.  She likes her loan group because it gives her the opportunity to share with friends and get out of her daily work routine, which they can't do on normal days.

Lilian, 49, is married and has three adult children from this relationship.  One of her children is married and lives with her, sharing the household expenses.  Another works and helps her with the expenses and also attends college.  Her last child attends school in the city.  Her husband works as a public employee.  The house they live in is her own.

Lilian has had a beauty salon for 18 years.  She's extremely professional and her experience has allowed her to expand her knowledge.  She makes the most of her business to sell her customers cosmetics and clothing from catalogues as well as natural products.

The money from Lilian's loan is to buy hair dye, clothing, and cosmetics.

Her goal is for her children to be entrepreneurs and to start and expand a business.

loans.use: to buy hair dye, clothing, and cosmetics

loans.name: Orlando Favio

texts.es: El señor Orlando es soltero, de condición muy humilde, salió bachiller pero por cuestiones económicas no prosiguió con sus estudios superiores, es una persona trabajadora y tiene gran experiencia en el rubro de la construcción civil ya que lleva más de 4 años en esta actividad desempeñando su labor con mucha eficiencia y dedicación, actualmente solicita un crédito para construir su vivienda, ubicado en la Comunidad de San Mateo, y de esta forma mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Orlando is single and he is from a modest background. He finished secondary school but for economic reasons, he did not continue with his higher education. He is a hardworking person and he has a lot of civil construction experience. He has more than four years in this field. He does his work with a lot of efficiency and dedication. Now he is requesting a loan to build his home. It is located in the San Mateo community. With this, he will improve the conditions of his life.

loans.use: build his house.

loans.name: Martín Francisco

texts.es: Martín Francisco se ha dedicado a la producción de café por más de 15 años y fue gracias a su padre que aprendió este oficio. Para esta cosecha necesita comprar fertilizante para sus fincas, pues hace poco resembró una parte. Además de producir café Martín Francisco trabaja como chofer para tener un mejor ingreso para su familia.
texts.en: Martin Francisco has worked in the production of coffee for more than 15 years, and it was thanks to his father that he learned this work. For this harvest, he needs to buy fertilizer for his farm, since he replanted one part recently. In addition to producing coffee, Martín Francisco works as a driver in order to have a better income for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his farm

loans.name: Cira

texts.en:
Cira is 45 years old and married with five children. With four children still in school, Cira works very hard to provide for them.

Cira runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, snack foods, candy, milk, cereal, chocolate drinks, etc. to sell.

Cira has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, candy, milk, cereal, chocolate drinks, etc. 

In the future, Cira would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, snack foods, candy, milk, cereal, chocolate drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Aigerim

texts.en:
My name is Aigerim. I have graduated from a high school this year and enrolled at the American University of Central Asia, department of Psychology. AUCA is one of the best Universities in Central Asia.
 
I live in a family of 7, including myself. My parents pay for my siblings as well, which makes it difficult for them to cover the tuition fees for all of us, but I still want the best education I can get. During my studies in high school, I tried hard to be able to get appropriate scores in the AUCA entrance exams. So now that I am already a student, I am really happy that I will study at the university of my dream.

I hope I will be one of those students who will be awarded a Kiva loan so that I could be able to study and not think about the financial restrictions I have now.

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Taj Muhammad

texts.en:
Taj Muhammad is 45 years old and is living with his eight children in Lahore, Pakistan. His job is to buy old electronic accessory parts such as televisions, radios, motherboards, etc. for getting metallic parts such as copper, aluminum, silver, etc. 

After crushing the electronic components; he separates and sorts the metals according to the category. After categorizing them, he puts the metals in a high temperature machine for melting; after melting the metals he pours it into the dies to give it a block shape. After manufacturing the metal blocks, he sell it into the market and gets a profit.
 
Recently, his crushing machine broke which is very costly and beyond his purchasing capacity. Therefore, Taj Muhammad requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he can buy a crushing machine.

He is very hopeful that this loan will prove productive and beneficial for his enterprise. He thanks Kiva, Kiva lenders and his field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a crushing machine for recycling metals.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 44 years old and married with four children. With three children currently in school, Lilibeth works very hard to provide for them.

Lilibeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, noodles, diapers, sanitary napkins, laundry soap, bath soap, etc. to sell.

Lilibeth has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, diapers, sanitary napkins, laundry soap, bath soap, etc. 

In the future, Lilibeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, noodles, diapers, sanitary napkins, laundry soap, bath soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Delsa

texts.en:
Delsa is 50 years old and married with seven children.

Delsa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Delsa aspires to save money so she can afford to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nadzuwa

texts.en:
Nadzuwa is a married woman who has three children, all of whom go to school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Nadzuwa operates a cereal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality.

With the 40,000 KES loan she wants to purchase sacks of maize, beans, and rice for resale.She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize, beans, and rice for resale.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works hard to support her family. She has a live-in partner and has a food and fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years now.

Marites requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fish and ingredients for her business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana esta agradecida por el préstamo y se siente feliz por el apoyo brindado, ella desea continuar participando en este interesante proyecto por lo tanto ella sigue viviendo en la ciudad de Salvación y con el negocio de recolectar mariposas y venta de comestibles, ella desea implementar su pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio y desea incrementar en la mercadería por lo tanto en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería al por mayor como sacos de azúcar y sacos de arroz. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en: Juana is grateful for the loan, and she feels happy about the support offered. She wants to continue participating in this interesting project, and thus she continues living in the city of Salvación and having her businesses of collecting butterflies and selling food. She wants to stock her little grocery store in her home, and she wants to expand the merchandise. Therefore, at this time she needs a loan to buy merchandise wholesale, such as sacks of sugar and sacks of rice. She appreciates and values the loan, and she promises to make her monthly payments.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale supplies like sacks of sugar and sacks of rice.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irene is 21 years old, married to Geoffry, and supports three members of her family. She is into tea selling business in Chemundu location in Kapsabet. 

This has been her income generating business for the last three years. She gets an average monthly income of KES 4,000. She plans to use the amount of KES 25,000 borrowed to buy tea leaves for resale. 

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: Domny Oswaldo

texts.es:
Domny es un hombre de 34 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el es muy trabajador entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Domny no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Domny trabaja como chofer de furgón brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Domny se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizará el mejoramiento y refacción de su vehículo, ya que desea tenerlo en mejores condiciones para seguir trabajando, así pues Domny seguirá esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una casa adecuada y segura para su familia.
texts.en:
Domny is a 34 year old man. He lives in the city of Pucallpa with his wife and two children. He is enthusiastic and hard-working, and puts all his efforts towards providing the best for his family. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and the fact that he had to work, Domny was not able to go to university. 

By his own initiative, Domny drives a van to provide transport services in his city. He works everyday for about 10 hours, and believes that he is doing well due to his dedication and hard work. 

Domny is very grateful to the KIVA lenders, as thanks to their help he will be able to make improvements to and replace parts in his vehicle. He wants the van to be in better condition in order to continue working. This will allow Domny to continue working hard and achieve his great dream of having a safe and suitable house for his family.

loans.use: to make improvements to his vehicle.

loans.name: Ancelmo

texts.es: El señor Ancelmo, vive en una comunidad alejada, sus hijos y su mamá se fueron hace más de 8 años al exterior, desde entonces quedo solo. Se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura en un pequeña parcela que adquirió con mucho trabajo y sacrificio, ademas a veces trabaja como jornalero en otras zonas para tener mas ingresos y así mantenerse. En  la anterior cosecha hubo un desastre natural  que hizo bajar considerablemente sus ingresos económicos, por ello está solicitando un crédito para comprar semilla de papa  y abono orgánico para mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos y obtener mayores beneficios.
texts.en:
Ancelmo lives in a rural community. His children and their mother left the country 8 years ago, and since then, Ancelmo has lived alone. 

Ancelmo earns a living by farming a small piece of land which he obtained through a lot of work and sacrifice. Sometimes he also works as a laborer in other areas in order to have more income and support himself. 

During the previous harvest, there was a natural disaster which considerably reduced his income. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy potato seeds and organic fertilizer in order to improve the quality of his crop and to get higher earnings.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en: Ligaya has helped her husband on their farm for a living. She is looking for ways to improve their situation. She joined GDMPC recently and is requesting a loan to purchase grocery goods to restock her store. Hopefully, she will make enough from this to supplement their income. She is hoping to sustain her store this time and earn a stable source of income in the future. She is thankful to GDMPC for allowing its members to borrow capital for their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase grocery goods to restock her store

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is age 45 and lives with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has five children only. Her husband’s income is not good but due to having few family members she can easily manage the household expenses. 

She is taking a loan for her husband’s painting shop, In fact, her husband provides the services of banner writing for advertisements or publishing politicians' messages. His writing is very attractive because he has been writing banners for many years and has great practice of banner writing. 

He uses pieces of cheap cloth, paint, and brushes for banner writing. He does not have enough stock of paint and cloth to continue his services. Therefore, Naseem requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy multi-coloured cans of paint, brushes, and cloth. 

Naseem thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy pieces of cloth, paint, and brushes for banner writing.

loans.name: Remelyn

texts.en:
Remelyn is 23 years old and married with one child. Remelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Remelyn has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from e-loading (mobile prepaid load).

Remelyn aspires to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 61 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Florencia has a general store business in the Philippines. Florencia requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods like snack foods, canned goods, candies, cooking oil, laundry soap, hair conditioner, etc. to sell.

Florencia has been in this business for 4 years. Florencia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods like snack foods, canned goods, candies, cooking oil, laundry soap, hair conditioner, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima is a student of AUCA and here is her story:

“There are lots of reasons that motivate me to apply at AUCA. These reasons have generated a spiritual or emotional feeling in my self to choose AUCA for future education in order to fulfill my career objectives successfully.  AUCA's acknowledgment and credibility in the education world would provide me a competitive edge over the other students.  This university has tried with so many well-known and emerging organizations and government agencies so it would help me excel in my professional career.

The last year at high school I started thinking about my future profession.  Sure enough, it was easy for me to choose my profession.  There are a lot of universities in my country and they are different from each other.  I decided to study at AUCA. Successfully I decided to first start from the New Generation Academy within AUCA, which helped me fill my educational gaps and it greatly prepared me to find myself and my future profession.  I decided to study Journalism in the Mass Communications Department.  Of course it was not easy to find my future profession but now I freely can say that I fell in love with this department.  I have been introduced to lots of students from the JMC Department, they really gave me piece of advice how to study well and how to write clear articles.  When I studied at school I was minister of media, and every day I had to write articles and take photos. 

I am a sociable person.  I have participated in different and useful programs such as “Access Micro scholarship program”. I am also an alumni of the program, “Technology age Girls” – where I am finalist of this project, “New Generation Academy”.  I am well organized, responsible and patient, with goals to achieve. 

Another great opportunity that AUCA gives to it's students is that it gives a loan to cover tuition fees.  This loan is given through Kiva and all students entering AUCA are able to apply for it.  I also have financial restrictions in my family and am applying for it.”

loans.use: to pay for higher education.

loans.name: Victoriia

texts.en:
Victoriia is a student of AUCA and this is her story:

“All the people of the planet dream about a profession which would have brought them joy, an opportunity to improve them, and to help people. But to get a decent reward from the work done and necessary to the society work. There are lots of good and necessary professions, but I wanted to become a journalist, because it is one of the most demanded professions in the modern rapidly-changing world. My task will be the need for timely, reliable, interesting information to bring to people. As the journalist profession attracts me the possibility to travel, meet with different people to learn their culture, art, history, everyday life, traditions and customs, to be acquainted with the peculiar nature, new hitherto unknown territories to the planet. 

I am very glad that I had an opportunity to realize the dream as AUCA is exactly one of the best universities in our country. Here a child can be grown up to a professional. AUCA employs competent, intelligent, caring and friendly people – professionals, and the system of training and education is very modern, creative and tolerant.

Unfortunately, my family is unable to cover the tuition fees fully. Therefore I am applying for Kiva loan. Kiva loan is one of great opportunities that AUCA gives to each student.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 60 years old and a widow with three children.

Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Evelyn has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty years, and earns an income from food vending.

Evelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Melinda is 49 years old and has four children who are still in school.

Melinda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Melinda has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Melinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is still single with no children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past five years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, bananas, coconuts, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, bananas, coconuts, rice, beans, and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 51 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Myrna is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional livestock, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

Myrna has been raising livestock for six years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She would like to apply for a loan of ksh. 50,000 to purchase hair extensions, hair treatment, and shampoos. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions, hair treatment, and shampoos.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 39 years old. She is married and has one college-age child. She lives in Misom Baliangao Misamis Occidental. Fely has been engaged in a sari-sari store (general store) business for 10 years and earns a monthly income of 7000 PHP. 

She requested a new loan to purchase various groceries, beverages, 5 sacks of rice, and 5 sacks of feed to sell to customers. Fely has remained a member in good standing in her membership in PAGLAUM MPC since 2000.

loans.use: to purchase 5 sacks of rice, 5 sacks of feed, and various groceries and beverages.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta 9º grado, ya que sus padres no pudieron apoyarle,  para que siguiera con sus estudios. Esta casado, su esposa trabaja como ama de casa, tienen 3 hijos de 15, 14 y 11 años de edad, quienes estudian. 


Miguel desde que dejo la escuela, se dedico a trabajar en agricultura junto a su padre, sembrabando maíz y sorgo. Pero luego, de un tiempo, Miguel tubo la oportunidad de iniciar con un nuevo empleo, el cual era de agente de seguridad, así es como hasta el día de hoy, tiene aproximadamente 15 años de estar laborando en esta área. Trabaja en la alcaldía del pueblo donde vive, su horario son turnos de 24 horas continuas de trabajo-descanso y viceversa y  esta a 3 km de su casa, viaja en su bicicleta.


El préstamo lo utilizara, para comprar materiales de construcción: de los cuales necesitara arena, grava, cemento, hierro y ladrillo. Ademas cancelar los gastos de mano de obra, de la persona que realizara el trabajo. Con el préstamo se estará ayudando a que Miguel, construya una parte del muro, lo que le permitirá que asegure mas su casa y su familia este mas tranquila y segura.

Miguel siempre ha querido tener un negocio propio y dedicarse a este, ya que en el área que se esta desempeñando actualmente, el trabajo es muy agotador y el desgaste físico y mental es muy estresante. También esta dispuesto a ayudarles a sus hijos, para que  estudien y  se preparen profesionalmente y no sufran las dificultades que enfrento él.
texts.en:
Miguel is 39 years old. He studied until the 9th grade, as his parents weren't able to support him to study further. He is married. His wife stays at home. They have 3 children who are 15, 14, and 11 years old and all three are in school. 

After leaving school, Miguel began to farm with his father, growing corn and sorghum. However, after some time, Miguel had the opportunity to start a new job as a security guard. He has been doing this for 15 years now. He works in the mayor's office in the village where he lives. His schedule alternates between 24 hours of work and 24 hours of rest. His job is located 3 km from his house, and he gets there by bicycle. 

He plans to use the loan to purchase construction materials: sand, gravel, cement, iron bars, and bricks. He also needs to pay the person who will provide the labor. The loan will help construct a part of a wall which will allow him to make sure that his home and family are safe and sound. 

Miguel has always wanted to have his own business and earn his living this way, as the job he currently has is very exhausting, and the physical and mental fatigue is very stressful. He also wants to support his children so that they can study and have careers, and avoid facing the difficulties that he did.

loans.use: to buy construction materials: sand, gravel, cement, iron bars, bricks, as well as labor.

loans.name: Shehzadi

texts.en:
Shehzadi is the 43-year-old mother of three children living in Lahore, Pakistan. She must do all the daily routine tasks alone which makes her tired every day. She has to look after her young children and elderly parents. She wants to purchase a separate house for her family in which she could feel comfortable and relaxed.
Her husband owns a medical clinic in which he provides first aid services to the patients. He has been taking training from a professional MBBS doctor, and now he owns his own small clinic on the basis of his experience. He has been treating his patients who have recovered well. He has become very famous in their society and wants to establish his clinic through the latest medical instruments, medicines, injections, and glucose but he does not have capital.
Therefore, Shehzadi requested a loan for her husband; she hopes that her husband would be able to buy medicine so that he could earn maximum profit. 
Shehzadi hopes that through the profit amount she will be able to buy a new house soon.

loans.use: To buy medical instruments, medicines, drips, injections, glucose, etc. for a medical clinic.

loans.name: Meerim

texts.en:
My name is Meerim. I am from Talas city of Kyrgyz Republic. I have graduated from a high school this year and enrolled at the American University of Central Asia, department of International and Comparative Politics.
 
AUCA has been the University of my dream, and I am really happy to be enrolled. AUCA is one of the best Universities in Central Asia that gives the best higher education to its students. So, after graduation, I will be able to become an independent person in the future, and make contributions to my family and country.

I live in a family of seven; my parents and five sisters. I am the oldest sister and feel responsible for my sisters. Therefore, I enrolled the American University of Central Asia, which will give me an excellent higher education to be independent enough to support them in the future.
 
But my family is not able to cover the tuition fees without an additional source. So, I don’t really want money to be a deterrent factor, stopping me from studies.
